commit_message:
Add HTTP GET support for vendor_passthru API

Change-Id: Ifb6aa39e5dab98899ec919579a7c1131332dfce6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-specs refs/changes/46/108646/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252\cocoartf1265\cocoasubrtf210 {\fonttbl\f0\fmodern\fcharset0 Courier;} {\colortbl;\red255\green255\blue255;} \paperw11900\paperh16840\margl1440\margr1440\vieww33400\viewh18440\viewkind0 \deftab720 \pard\pardeftab720 \f0\fs26 \cf0 ================================================\ HTTP GET method support for vendor_passthru APIs \ ================================================\ \ https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ironic/+spec/get-vendor-passthru\ \ Today vendor_passthru APIs support only POST/config operations only. \ There is no way of retrieving bare-metal node related details without explicit-\ ly logging into the bare-metal node. \ \ Problem description\ ===================\ \ Today vendor_passthru APIs supports POST operations that are\ used for updating the specific configuration on bare-natal node. But\ there is no direct way to retrieve/monitor the node details, like \ * Firmware version\ * Power, Temperature statistics. \ * Faults\ * Inventory. etc\ \ As there is no GET API option available, It is difficult to integrate Ironic\ with other OpenStack/third-party components to monitor the bare-metal node\ health, faults, statistics etc. \ \ Proposed change\ ===============\ \ Vendor_passthru APIs already supports HTTP POST method. As part of the change \ reuse this existing part of framework and add GET method support. Unlike POST \ method support, where it spawns a new task and returns, the GET vendor_passthru\ API call would be blocking call. As GET method returns value to the user, the \ call is blocked until the conductor returns the response or the blocking call \ reaches pre-defined timeout. \ \ Alternatives\ ------------\ \ There are no alternatives. User have to login to bare-maetal node and fetch the\ inventory,faults etc., manually. or Extend the other openstack/third-party com-\ ponents to talk to bare-metal nodes and get these details. Either way, user \ have to know the list of here-metal nodes enrolled in Ironic and perform the \ operations. \ \ Data model impact\ -----------------\ None.\ \ REST API impact\ ---------------\ \ Adding support for vendor_passthru GET method. \ \ * Method type - GET\ \ * Expected error http response code(s)\ \ If unsuccessful, eg an invalid driver name was specified, \ it returns HTTP status 404 and an error message.\ If successful, it returns HTTP status 200 and the response \ (in Json format) is a list of \ <property-name>: <value>\ \ Ex: /node/<node_uuid>/vendor_passthru?method=get_firmware_version return:\ \ \{"Dn": "sys/chassis-1/blade-5/fw-status", \ "OperState": "ready", \ "PackageVersion": "2.1(1a)B\'94\} \ \ * No parameters are passed via the url.\ \ \ Driver API impact\ -----------------\ \ None.\ \ Nova driver impact\ ------------------\ None.\ \ Security impact\ ---------------\ \ None\ \ Other end user impact\ ---------------------\ \ This requires the python-ironicclient changes for adding CLI support. \ Changes to print the GET method results in readable format like other CLIs \ output.\ \ Example:\ usage: ironic node-vendor-passthru <node id> <method_type> <method>\ [<arg=value> [<arg=value> ...]]\ \ stack@juno:/$ ironic node-vendor-passthru <node_uuid> get get_faults\ \ * As of now there is no interface to invoke the vendor_passthru APIs from \ Horizon.\ Not considering to add support for the same as part of this blueprint. \ \ Scalability impact\ ------------------\ \ * As the info is not stored in DB, GET method support would not have any \ impact on database traffic. \ \ * Each call to the GET API would result in conductor querying the data from \ bare-metal node. \ \ * There might have impact on network, RPC calls depending on the frequency of \ call made by the user/end-applications. \ \ Performance Impact\ ------------------\ \ There is no other performance impact other than what is discussed in \ \'91Scalability Impact\'92 section. \ \ Other deployer impact\ ---------------------\ \ None.\ \ Developer impact\ ----------------\ \ None\ \ Implementation\ ==============\ \ Assignee(s)\ -----------\ \ \ Primary assignee:\ saripurigopi\ \ Other contributors:\ <launchpad-id or None>\ \ Work Items\ ----------\ \ * Changes to ironic-api to process GET methods for vendor_passthru APIs.\ * Changes to ironic-conductor for handle GET methods requests. \ * Changes to the python-ironicclient, add support for GET vendor_passthru CLIs.\ \ Dependencies\ ============\ \ None.\ \ Testing\ =======\ \ Tempest test can be added for node_level GET operations. But this requires the\ list of supported GET methods per driver. This isn't not as generic. In order \ to support this, we need to have a way to get the list of vendor_passthru APIs\ supported by driver with the signature of the methods. If required that can be\ tracked as different request.\ \ Documentation Impact\ ====================\ \ Documentation have to be updated with the HTTP GET method availability for \ vendor_passthru APIs.\ \ \ References\ ==========\ \ None. \ }

commit_message:
Add spec for add instance name to various commands in CLI

blueprint add-instance-name-to-cli

Change-Id: Ieb099b51467706328d5e38f30f4de8bc97c5e723
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove-specs refs/changes/24/136424/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode Sections of this template were taken directly from the Nova spec template at: https://github.com/openstack/nova-specs/blob/master/specs/template.rst .. ======================================================= Add instance name as parameter to various CLI commands ======================================================= Blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/trove/+spec/add-instance-name-to-cli The proposal is to allow instance-name to be specified wherever instance-ID is currently used throughout the CLI. Problem description =================== Currently, only the "trove show" command will take instance-ID or instance-name as its parameter. There are many more commands in the CLI that require an instance reference as a parameter but require that the instance-ID be used. It would be helpful to customers to be able to use instance-ID or instance-name interchangeably throughtout the CLI. Proposed change =============== Allow instance-id or instance-name to be passed in for the following commands: backup-create backup-list-instance configuration-attach configuration-default configuration-detach database-create database-delete database-list detach-replica delete metadata-create metadata-delete metadata-edit metadata-list metadata-show metadata-update resize-flavor resize-instance resize-volume restart root-enable root-show update user-create user-delete user-grant-access user-list user-revoke-access user-show user-show-access user-update-attributes For example, trove delete currently looks like this: usage: trove delete <instance> Deletes an instance. Positional arguments: <instance> ID of the instance. The proposal is to make it look like this: usage: trove delete <instance> Deletes an instance. Positional arguments: <instance> ID or name of the instance. Configuration ------------- None Database -------- None Public API ---------- This will add instance-name as an option on the above stated commands in the CLI. Internal API ------------ None Guest Agent ----------- None Alternatives ------------ None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: 0-doug (dougshelley66) peterstac Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: Kilo-2 Work Items ---------- - go through python-troveclient/troveclient/v1/shell.py and call _find_instance(cs, args.instance) ahead of the "real" work in each "do_<>" method. - Alter the help text in shell.py to indicate the use of name or ID. - Alter the existing unit tests as appropriate. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= If we had Tempest coverage for the CLI it would be adjusted to exercise passing instance name to all the altered commands. Also, there is an existing LP bug [1] that indicates we should write tests for the CLI. Both of these are considered out of scope for this BP. [1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/python-troveclient/+bug/1314793 Documentation Impact ==================== The help text for the aforementioned commands will be altered to now include instance name as a valid parameter. I believe that the CLI documentation is generated from the code. References ========== None

commit_message:
Design spec for iLO driver for firmware settings

The HP iLO subsystem is a standard component of
HP ProLiant servers that simplifies initial
server setup, server health monitoring, power
and thermal optimization, and remote server
administration.

This proposal adds support for firmware
settings interfaces introduced in
base.ManagementInterface to iLO client python
library to support HP Proliant servers using iLO.

Change-Id: I66c444571b3d4343afa957e1b3f617c8a07b1328
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-specs refs/changes/65/103065/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== iLO Management Driver for Ironic ========================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ironic/+spec/firmware-settings The HP iLO subsystem is a standard component of HP ProLiant servers that simplifies initial server setup, server health monitoring, power and thermal optimization, and remote server administration. This proposal adds support for firmware settings interfaces introduced in base.ManagementInterface to iLO client python library to support HP Proliant servers using iLO. Problem description =================== To add new iLOManagement() module that will conform to base.ManagementInterface. This module uses iLO credentials (ilo_address, ilo_username, ilo_password), specified in the driver_info property of the Node to connect to target iLO. Proposed change =============== iLOManagement module will implement following interfaces provided by the base.ManagementInterface:- * get_supported_boot_devices(self) * set_boot_device(self, task, device,**kwargs) * get_boot_device(self, task) iLOManagement module would also implement following new interfaces proposed as part of the firmware setting feature. These new interfaces are recommended under base.ManagementInterface:- * get_firmware_settings(self, task,*args) * set_firmware_settings(self, task,*args) * get_supported_boot_modes(self, task) * get_current_boot_mode(self, task) * get_pending_boot_mode(self, task) * set_pending_boot_mode(self, task, mode) * get_one_time_boot_device(self, task) * set_one_time_boot_device(self, task, device) * get_nic_boot_mode(self, task) * set_nic_boot_mode(self, task,*args) * get_boot_order(self, task) * set_boot_order(self, task,*args) Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Driver API impact ----------------- None Nova driver impact ------------------ None Security impact --------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Scalability impact ------------------ None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Shivanand Tendulker (stendulker) Other contributors: None Work Items ---------- Implement iLOManagement module to to define all abstract functions listed in base.ManagementInterface. Dependencies ============ API, RPCapi and Conductor side changes for the firmware settings feature listed above. Testing ======= Unit testcases will be added. Documentation Impact ==================== iLO driver documentation will be updated mentioning about the new capabilities. References ========== https://github.com/hpproliant/proliantutils https://pypi.python.org/pypi/proliantutils HP iLO4 User Guide: http://h20628.www2.hp.com/km-ext/kmcsdirect/emr_na-c03334051-10.pdf

commit_message:
Propose a non-voting rally gate job

A spec for the creation of rally-scenarios to be run as an
additional gate check job for Ceilometer.

Change-Id: I1ff7eec3b285b2657e111bf6b3a76bbf1f745f01
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/telemetry-specs refs/changes/22/129922/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================ Rally Gate Check ================ https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ceilometer/+spec/rally-gate-check `Rally`_ provides support for what it calls `rally-gate`_ jobs. These automate a set of non-voting, custom benchmark scenarios that effectively make it possible to observe the performance impact of changes. Ceilometer's overall performance is the result of complex interactions in several systems, automating benchmarks of these systems will save time and provide useful information. .. _Rally: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Rally .. _rally-gate: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Rally/RallyGates Problem description =================== At this time there are no generally available automated benchmarks for Ceilometer performance. Both developers and deployers would appreciate knowing if code changes will improve or damage performance. Proposed change =============== A non-voting gate check job will be created to run a set of benchmark scenarios against each Ceilometer patchset. This job is controlled through multiple changes: * A ``rally-scenarios`` directory in the Ceilometer code tree containing a ``ceilometer.yaml`` file that describes the Rally scenarios to be used in the job. * An addition to `projects.yaml`_ that adds ``rally-jobs`` to the ``jobs`` list. * An update to `zuul layout`_ that adds ``check-rally-dsvm-ceilometer`` to the ``check`` list of the ``opensstack/ceilometer`` section. .. _projects.yaml: https://github.com/openstack-infra/project-config/blob/master/jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml .. _zuul layout: https://github.com/openstack-infra/project-config/blob/master/zuul/layout.yaml Alternatives ------------ Another option would be to automate performance checking outside of the gate such that instead of doing checking on every patchset a daily report was run on master. This would serve a similar but not identical purpose: it would help to evaluate the improvement of Ceilometer at large but not specific changes. Data model impact ----------------- None. REST API impact --------------- None. Security impact --------------- None. Pipeline impact --------------- None. Other end user impact --------------------- Some end users may be able to use the benchmark information to make decisions about how they configure their installations. It seems unlikely, however, that they will want to review this data from gerrit. Performance/Scalability Impacts ------------------------------- Totz amazeballs, everything will get faster when we look at it. Other deployer impact --------------------- None. Developer impact ---------------- As features are added, the rally scenarios may be insufficient and need to be updated. Ideally the scenarios will be high-level enough that this will be rare. When they are not it will be up to the feature developer to update the rally scenarios. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Who is leading the writing of the code? Or is this a blueprint where you're throwing it out there to see who picks it up? If more than one person is working on the implementation, please designate the primary author and contact. Primary assignee: chdent Other contributors: Volunteers welcome Ongoing maintainer: chdent Work Items ---------- In addition to the steps listed in the Proposed Solution section above the major chunk of work is in selecting and/or creating the necessary Rally tasks. Rally itself includes many sample scenarios and runners and includes a `gate check`_ in its own tree which includes several Ceilometer checks that may be used as starting point. .. _gate check: https://github.com/stackforge/rally/tree/master/rally-scenarios Future lifecycle ================ As stated in "Developer Impact" new features may require new scenarios. Dependencies ============ * Rally. Testing ======= The proposal adds a new (non-voting) gate job which will act as its own test. Documentation Impact ==================== None. References ========== No additional references beyond the links above.

subject: Driver for NetApp storage arrays
revisions:

commit_message:
Driver for NetApp storage arrays

Change-Id: I4a046f1be26bd80b263e4785fdfc1136a3227a63
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-specs refs/changes/57/102557/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ======================= NetApp hardware control ======================= We have interest in controlling NetApp filers with Ironic, for power control, serial console, and potentially metrics gathering where SNMP is unavailable. This blueprint does *not* propose creation or management of volumes on filers, or other tasks related to storage operations. Those tasks are outside the scope of Ironic and belong in another project (such as Cinder). Problem description =================== Broadly speaking, OpenStack operators have a need to manage more than compute nodes. Just as cloud operators want to rack compute nodes and provision them, there is a need to rack new storage hardware and provision it. This blueprint does *not* address tasks such as creating storage volumes, which is outside the scope of what Ironic was designed for. We will: * Enable powering on or off storage controllers. * Enable attaching to a serial console on the filers. * Enable metrics to be gathered from hardware controllers, analogous to IPMI sensors, where such metrics are not available through SNMP. Proposed change =============== The two filers we wish to support are fairly disparate: * The NetApp E-series filers, which expose an RPC interface ("Symbol"), but through a NetApp-provided REST API; no out-of-band management; cannot be powered on remotely * The NetApp FAS-series filers, which include out-of-band management via SSH as well as a rich HTTP API (ONTAP) They are sufficiently distinct that two separate drivers will be authored: The E-series driver will be wrapped behind the REST API, and provide: * Hardware metrics (via API call) * Power off and reboot commands (but power *on* is not possible) * Eventual firmware upgrade support The FAS-series will be a bit different, and is more of a WIP. Enterprise configurations here are often done by hand, and what is more interesting is managing "storage virtual machines". This starts to test the bounds of what Ironic should be responsible for, however. I have written a basic driver for the lights-out card on the FAS filers, which simply uses for power control. There is doubt about whether this is useful. A serial console (via that SSH interface) is also feasible. Alternatives ------------ I think the only logical 'alternative' is to *not* implement support for these. (I.e., decide that they best belong out of tree.) Not strictly a functional 'alternative', but we need to bear in mind here how much of this Cinder, etc. should own. I would maintain that power control operations are not a Cinder task, however. For the E-series, an alternative to the REST API would be to natively implement (or find a freely-licensed client library, which a quick Google search did not turn up) the Symbol API. This would have the benefit of bypassing the need for a separate REST API server to be configured by end users, but at the cost of considerably complexity in the Ironic driver. Data model impact ----------------- The data model impact should be minimal. We should just need to store a hostname and credentials for management, along with the API endpoint; this is consistent with most other drivers. REST API impact --------------- No API change is required. (FIXME: other than getting hardware metrics, but that is not unique to us.) Driver API impact ----------------- There is no impact to existing or core drivers. We are merely implementing a new driver, which should behave consistently with existing drivers. It is likely not possible/practical to provide physical hardware for true CI. (Such arrays typically cost tens of thousands of dollars.) However, our interfaces are not esoteric, and will consist of basic ssh calls and REST API calls, which should not be difficult to mock out, and which should not change in the code. Nova driver impact ------------------ None; this is not a compute driver. Security impact --------------- There should not be any new security issues for Ironic itself. A potential security concern does arise from having Ironic store credentials for a storage array in its database. The storing of sensitive credentials is not new; it's already done for every IPMI-managed compute node, along with any SSH-based ones. A shared storage array may potentially host information for a large number of tenants/customers, or even files/volumes backing the cloud itself. Other end user impact --------------------- The end user impact should be nil. We will be managing the Ironic interface to storage arrays just as other nodes are handled today. Scalability impact ------------------ This should be nominal. Each storage array will appear as one node. The SSH and REST interfaces we speak with could operate slowly or time out. This is not at all unique to this driver, though; IPMI or existing SSH drivers can (and do) sometimes operate slowly or time out. Performance Impact ------------------ This should be the same as with the Scalability section -- nothing unique versus managing existing compute nodes. Other deployer impact --------------------- * Deployers will need to whitelist the driver to use it. (It almost certainly should not be included by default.) * Deployers will need documentation on the above, as well as on what credentials and information to feed Ironic. (Management IP and credentials.) Developer impact ---------------- There should be no impact to developers. (Other than, of course, those that wish to contribute to or modify the driver.) Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Matt Wagner ('matt-wagner' on Launchpad) Other contributors: All are welcome! Work Items ---------- * Implement E-series driver (this should be reasonably simple) * Scope out what FAS-series driver should look like [FIXME(matty_dubs) - That will likely deserve its own blueprint.] Dependencies ============ Overall, this will target two types of specific hardware with non-standard interfaces. (That is, neither supports IPMI or the like.) Each has its own dependencies. E-Series -------- The driver will need to consume a non-OpenStack REST API. This requires little more than urllib2, however. Deployers will need to deploy https://communities.netapp.com/groups/appaware-webservic (SANtricity Web Services Proxy) to sit between Ironic and their filer. It does not appear to be open source, but is free (as in beer) for NetApp customers. (The alternative is to make the Ironic driver support the non-HTTP RPC API that the storage device speaks, which is a substantially larger task.) FAS-Series ---------- The interaction with the FAS-series drivers should probably be the subject of a follow-on blueprint down the road. At a high level, it will require: * An SSH-driver for the management card, for power control (not a new dependency) * A SOAP web client to interact with the ONTAP "ZAPI" We'll probably want to pull in something like https://pypi.python.org/pypi/NetAppZAPI/ to interact with the ZAPI. Testing ======= Due to (lack of) hardware availability (and cost), having live, third-party hardware for integration testing is not feasible. However, unit tests will be provided. It is possible to mock out any API calls made to ensure our use of the exposed APIs remains consistent. Documentation Impact ==================== There should not be anything extraordinary. Just what is already under 'Other Deployer Impact' above, around how to whitelist the driver and how to add the 'node' to Ironic. References ========== Some of the information such as API docs is not available without a NetApp NOW account, and bears prominent copyright notices. The following is available, though: * Basic E-series overview: http://www.netapp.com/us/products/storage-systems/e5400/e5400-product-comparison.aspx * Information on the REST proxy for the E-series: https://communities.netapp.com/groups/appaware-webservic

commit_message:
Release 5.0.0 - Juno

This patch updated the README to reflect the current version and
include release notes.

Changes in this release:
* Pinned vcsrepo dependency to 2.x
* Bumped stdlib dependency to 4.x
* Added ability to hide secrets from puppet logs
* Removed orphaned os_concat function
* Removed dependencies on mysql and postgresql devel libraries

Change-Id: I4d3a497304219d4a19789f447c83f4b90f2a5846

commit_message:
Release 5.0.0 - Juno

Changes in this release:
* Added neutron::policy to control policy.json
* Added parameter allow_automatic_l3agent_failover to neutron::agents::l3
* Added parameter metadata_memory_cache_ttl to neutron::agents::metadata
* Added l3_ext as a provider_network_type property for neutron_network type
* Changed user_group parameter in neutron::agents::lbaas to have different defaults depending on operating system
* Changed openswan package to libreswan for RHEL 7 for vpnaas
* Ensured neutron package was installed before nova_admin_tenant_id_setter is called
* Added api_extensions_path parameter to neutron class
* Added database tuning parameters
* Changed management of file lines in /etc/default/neutron-server only for Ubuntu
* Add parameters to enable DVR and HA support in neutron::agents::l3 for Juno
* Fixed meaning of manage_service parameter in neutron::agents::ovs
* Made keystone user creation optional when creating a service
* Fixed the enable_dhcp property of neutron_subnet
* Added the ability to override the keystone service name in neutron::keystone::auth
* Fixed bug in parsing allocation pools in neutron_subnet type
* Added relationship to refresh neutron-server when nova_admin_tenant_id_setter changes
* Migrated the neutron::db::mysql class to use openstacklib::db::mysql and deprecated the mysql_module parameter
* Fixed the relationship between the HA proxy package and the neutron-lbaas-agent package
* Added kombu_reconnect_delay parameter to neutron class
* Fixed plugin.ini error when cisco class is used
* Fixed relationship between vs_pridge types and the neutron-plugin-ovs service
* Added neutron::agents::n1kv_vem to deploy N1KV VEM
* Added SSL support for nova_admin_tenant_id_setter
* Fixed relationship between neutron-server package and neutron_plugin_ml2 types
* Stopped puppet from trying to manage the ovs cleanup service
* Deprecated the network_device_mtu parameter in neutron::agents::l3 and moved it to the neutron class
* Added vpnaas_agent_package parameter to neutron::services::fwaas to install the vpnaas agent package

Change-Id: Ia9c491db751cce07c67236ed5ccfe2fb73e782ba
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/69/136669/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Release 5.0.0 - Juno

Changes in this release:
* Updated token driver, logging, and ldap config parameters for Juno
* Changed admin_roles parameter to accept an array in order to configure multiple admin roles
* Installs python-ldappool package for ldap
* Added new parameters to keystone class to configure pki signing
* Changed keystone class to inherit from keystone::params
* Changed pki_setup to run regardless of token provider
* Made UUID the default token provider
* Made keystone_user_role idempotent
* Added parameters to control whether to configure users
* Stopped managing _member_ role since it is created automatically
* Stopped overriding token_flush log file
* Changed the usage of admin_endpoint to not include the API version
* Allowed keystone_user_role to accept email as username
* Added ability to set up keystone using Apache mod_wsgi
* Migrated the keystone::db::mysql class to use openstacklib::db::mysql and deprecated the mysql_module parameter
* Installs python-memcache when using token driver memcache
* Enabled setting cert and key paths for PKI token signing
* Added parameters for SSL communication between keystone and rabbitmq
* Added parameter ignore_default_tenant to keystone::role::admin
* Added parameter service_provider to keystone class
* Added parameters for service validation to keystone class

Change-Id: Ib280f684c8babf40df51d62bb21497c88ba3fd29
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone refs/changes/68/136668/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Make get_next_device_name() handle an instance object

This utility method is passed an object, but does things that assume it
is a dict. This fixes that, and updates the tests to match.

Related to blueprint flavor-from-sysmeta-to-blob

Change-Id: I7041b8ffae100463eafe45926f0d16d00165ba73

commit_message:
Release 5.0.0 - Juno

Changes in this release:
* Added package_ensure parameters to various classes to control package installation
* Added ceilometer::policy to control policy.json
* Updated validate_re expressions for Puppet 3.7
* Bumped stdlib dependency to >=4.0.0
* Added manage_service parameters to various classes to control whether the service was managed, as well as added enabled parameters where not already present
* Added parameters to control whether to configure users
* Added the ability to override the keystone service name in keystone::auth
* Migrated the ceilometer::db::mysql class to use openstacklib::db::mysql and deprecated the mysql_module parameter
* Fixed ceilometer-notification package name for RHEL
* Removed deprecation notices for sectionless ceilometer_config types for Juno release
* Added ability to hide secrets from puppet logs

Change-Id: Ifda9dba6ef8a9eb99d1a5d2bf45aa74b210675dc

commit_message:
Don't run a query to check if the network exists

If the network does not exist, the query that inserts the port will
fail with a foreign key constraint failure.  This code is an attempt
to detect that and throw the NetworkNotFound exception when it is
caught.  This accomplishes the same goal as running
self._get_network(...) in the old code but without the extra query in
the non-exceptional case.  The non-exceptional case makes up the vast
majority of the times through this code path.

The old code doesn't use the result of the extra query for anything
else.  So, the ability to catch the error without incurring a DB call
is a performance gain.  How big?  It is hard to tell.   If nothing
else, this is a better database access pattern.

Change-Id: I8c8bd63b8c755265f4ef75eb2d3e75b9638d52c8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/83/122883/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo.db import exception as db_exc def _detect_network_not_found(create_port): def wrap(self, context, port): try: return create_port(self, context, port) except db_exc.DBError as e: if e.inner_exception and ( 'foreign key constraint' in str(e.inner_exception)): network_id=port['port']['network_id'] raise n_exc.NetworkNotFound(net_id=network_id) raise return wrap @_detect_network_not_found
deleted_lines: # Ensure that the network exists. self._get_network(context, network_id)

which is not a real version number. The next higher version is 1.2.0
which contains a bugfix that will break horizon's redirect
functionality (see https://bugs.launchpad.net/puppet-horizon/+bug/1390453).
This patch relaxes the minimum version to be over 1.0.0 but pins the

"}]
commit_message:
Relax apache min version and pin max version

Before this patch the module pinned its apache dependency to >=1.1.2
which is not a real version number. The next higher version is 1.2.0
which contains a bugfix that will break horizon's redirect
functionality (see https://bugs.launchpad.net/puppet-horizon/+bug/1390453).
This patch relaxes the minimum version to be over 1.0.0 but pins the
major version to be less than 1.2.0 as a stopgap while the bug in the
horizon module is fixed.

Change-Id: If12dfbb2d3c814f36f4d2e787434f90b7dc21cf4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-horizon refs/changes/50/136650/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: { "name": "puppetlabs/apache", "version_requirement": ">=1.0.0 <1.2.0" },

commit_message:
Release 5.0.0 - Juno

Changes in this release:
* Stable Juno release
* Added tags to all nova packages
* Added parameter dhcp_domain to nova class
* Updated the [glance] and [neutron] section parameters for Juno
* Fixed potential duplicate declaration errors for sysctl::value in nova::network
* Fixed dependency cycle in nova::migration::libvirt
* Updated the libvirtd init script path for Debian
* Added parameters for nova service validation to nova::api
* Added nova::policy to control policy.json
* Fixed the rabbit_virtual_host default in nova::cells
* Bumped stdlib dependency to >=4.0.0
* Added force_raw_images parameter to nova::compute class
* Replaced usage of the keyword type with the string 'type' since type is a reserved keyword in puppet 3.7
* Added parameter ec2_workers to nova::api
* Fixed bug in usage of --vlan versus --vlan_start in nova_network provider
* Added parameter rabbit_ha_queues to nova class
* Added parameter pool to nova_floating type
* Added parameters to control whether to configure keystone users
* Added nova::cron::archive_deleted_rows class to create a crontab for archiving deleted database rows
* Changed the keystone_service to only be configured if the endpoint is to be configured
* Added parameter keystone_ec2_url to nova::api
* Added the ability to override the keystone service name in ceilometer::keystone::auth
* Removed dynamic scoping of File resources in nova class
* Add parameter workers to in nova::conductor and deprecate conductor_workers in nova::api
* Update nova quota parameters for Juno
* Migrated the ceilometer::db::mysql class to use openstacklib::db::mysql and deprecated the mysql_module parameter
* Removed deprecation notice for sectionless nova_config names
* Added parameter vnc_keymap in nova::compute
* Added parameter osapi_v3 to nova::api

Change-Id: I8eec51429b52b5a4b5616fc6561075bf44c5ffda

run Nova SSL endpoints. * Updated RabbitMQ dependency. * Updated mysql charset to UTF8. * Pinned major gems.

commit_message:
Drop rabbitmq dependency to <4.0.0

The difference in rabbit versions between openstacklib, cinder and nova
causes dependency conflicts. Version 4 of the rabbitmq module dropped
support for setting up erlang. This patch drops the required version to
between 2.0.2 and 4.0.0 in order to line up with the other modules
rather than requiring the other modules to change their dependencies as
well as set up erlang.

Change-Id: I99383b28574958a43b88b4feb0025ad795a6fda2

added_lines: def reboot_instances(self, context, instance_id): """Requests a reboot of one or more instances. Args: context (RequestContext): The request context. instance_id (list of str): One or more instance IDs. Returns: true if the request succeeds. """ return instance.reboot_instances(context, instance_id) def stop_instances(self, context, instance_id, force=False): """Stops one or more instances. Args: context (RequestContext): The request context. instance_id (list of str): One or more instance IDs. force (boolean): Forces the instances to stop. The instances do not have an opportunity to flush file system caches or file system metadata. Not used now. Equivalent value is True. Returns: true if the request succeeds. """ return instance.stop_instances(context, instance_id, force) def start_instances(self, context, instance_id): """Starts one or more instances. Args: context (RequestContext): The request context. instance_id (list of str): One or more instance IDs. Returns: true if the request succeeds. """ return instance.start_instances(context, instance_id)

commit_message:
Always match lowercase MAC

In some places we are making comparisons between MACs
from different sources like:
* from DB - those are lowercase strings
* from other inputs - where we do not know if MAC will
  be lowercase, uppercase (or mixed) string
We need to always lowercase string in DB queries.

Also new utils function was created: is_same_mac to compare
if MACs are equal. It uses netaddr.EUI internally.

Change-Id: Idae5bc6009f857e72712afac04ffe174e73c7a87
Closes-Bug: #1394466
(cherry picked from commit dfe79d35a47a28873f271131cf2fdae7052e0713)

added_lines: def test_nic_mac_swap(self): mac_eth0 = '00:11:22:dd:ee:ff' mac_eth1 = 'aa:bb:cc:33:44:55' eth0 = { 'name': 'eth0', 'mac': mac_eth0, 'current_speed': 1, 'state': 'up' } eth1 = { 'name': 'eth1', 'mac': mac_eth1, 'current_speed': 1, 'state': 'up' } # prepare metadata with our interfaces meta = self.env.default_metadata() self.env.set_interfaces_in_meta(meta, [eth0, eth1]) # NOTE(prmtl) hack to have all mac set as we want # crete_node() will generate random mac for 1st iface # if we will not set it like that node_mac = meta['interfaces'][0]['mac'] node = self.env.create_node(api=True, meta=meta, mac=node_mac) self.env.create_cluster(api=True, nodes=[node['id']]) resp = self.app.get( reverse('NodeNICsHandler', kwargs={'node_id': node['id']}), headers=self.default_headers) original_nic_info = resp.json # swap macs, make them uppercase to check that we handle that correctly eth0['mac'], eth1['mac'] = eth1['mac'].upper(), eth0['mac'].upper() # update nodes with swapped macs new_meta = self.env.default_metadata() self.env.set_interfaces_in_meta(new_meta, [eth0, eth1]) node_data = {'mac': node['mac'], 'meta': new_meta} self.app.put( reverse('NodeAgentHandler'), jsonutils.dumps(node_data), headers=self.default_headers) # check that networks are assigned to the same interfaces resp = self.app.get( reverse('NodeNICsHandler', kwargs={'node_id': node['id']}), headers=self.default_headers) updated_nic_info = resp.json for orig_iface in original_nic_info: updated_iface = next( iface for iface in updated_nic_info if iface['mac'] == orig_iface['mac']) self.assertEqual( orig_iface['assigned_networks'], orig_iface['assigned_networks']) # nic names were swapped self.assertNotEqual(orig_iface['name'], updated_iface['name'])

commit_message:
Update i18n translation for ML2 plugin log msg's

All the existing LOG.info, LOG.warning, LOG.error and LOG.critical
messages should have _LI, _LW, _LE and _LC respectively.
 Also, debug level log shouldn't be translated.

This patch set will cover the ml2 directory under neutron/plugins.

Partial-Bug: #1320867
Change-Id: I9d78d23bbc14e7c536c6ddf2dc4f52c67faeb667

added_lines: from ec2api.openstack.common.db import exception as db_excdef s3_image_get_by_uuid(context, image_uuid): """Find local s3 image represented by the provided uuid.""" result = model_query(context, models.S3Image, read_deleted="yes").\ filter_by(uuid=image_uuid).\ first() if not result: raise exception.ImageNotFound(image_id=image_uuid) return result def s3_image_create(context, image_uuid): """Create local s3 image represented by provided uuid.""" try: s3_image_ref = models.S3Image() s3_image_ref.update({'uuid': image_uuid}) s3_image_ref.save() except Exception as e: raise db_exc.DBError(e) return s3_image_ref def _ec2_volume_get_query(context, session=None): return model_query(context, models.VolumeIdMapping, session=session, read_deleted='yes') @require_context def get_ec2_volume_id_by_uuid(context, volume_id): result = _ec2_volume_get_query(context).\ filter_by(uuid=volume_id).\ first() if not result: raise exception.VolumeNotFound(volume_id=volume_id) return result['id'] def ec2_snapshot_create(context, snapshot_uuid, id=None): """Create ec2 compatible snapshot by provided uuid.""" ec2_snapshot_ref = models.SnapshotIdMapping() ec2_snapshot_ref.update({'uuid': snapshot_uuid}) if id is not None: ec2_snapshot_ref.update({'id': id}) ec2_snapshot_ref.save() return ec2_snapshot_ref @require_context @require_context def instance_get_by_uuid(context, uuid, columns_to_join=None, use_slave=False): return _instance_get_by_uuid(context, uuid, columns_to_join=columns_to_join, use_slave=use_slave) def _instance_get_by_uuid(context, uuid, session=None, columns_to_join=None, use_slave=False): result = _build_instance_get(context, session=session, columns_to_join=columns_to_join, use_slave=use_slave).\ filter_by(uuid=uuid).\ first() if not result: raise exception.InstanceNotFound(instance_id=uuid) return result def _build_instance_get(context, session=None, columns_to_join=None, use_slave=False): query = model_query(context, models.Instance, session=session, project_only=True, use_slave=use_slave, read_deleted="no") return query def _block_device_mapping_get_query(context, session=None, columns_to_join=None, use_slave=False): if columns_to_join is None: columns_to_join = [] query = model_query(context, models.BlockDeviceMapping, session=session, use_slave=use_slave, read_deleted="no") return query @require_context def block_device_mapping_get_all_by_instance(context, instance_uuid, use_slave=False): return _block_device_mapping_get_query(context, use_slave=use_slave).\ filter_by(instance_uuid=instance_uuid).\ all()

commit_message:
Updates to reschedule_router() for DVR

The existing reschedule_router() only paritially supports
multiple agents per router.  For example, _unbind_router()
is called for multiple agents, but only one agent is notified
via router_added_to_agent() after rescheduling is done.

Also, the snat binding needs to removed prior to any
rescheduling.

Change-Id: I56fefb0f3f6253531e11805e365c9f1d98a45c5b
Partial-Bug: #1348309
Partially-implements: blueprint neutron-ovs-dvr

subject: Test that a namespace is created for new routers

This test implements a check to make sure that when creating a new
router which is connected to an internal network, a new namespace in the
format of 'qrouter-<id>' is created.

 - [2/3] - Add Integration Tests framework
 - [3/3] - Test that a namespace is created for new routers

commit_message:
Test that a namespace is created for new routers

This test implements a check to make sure that when creating a new
router which is connected to an internal network, a new namespace in the
format of 'qrouter-<id>' is created.

This is part of the integration tests effort:
 - [1/3] - Add ability to run daemonized Neutron processes
 - [2/3] - Add Integration Tests framework
 - [3/3] - Test that a namespace is created for new routers

Implements: blueprint integration-tests
Change-Id: I3092f6a8987666afa988f39d79219b74aa3e5a66

neutron.tests.integration import base from neutron.tests.integration import resources from neutron.tests.integration import templates class TestL3Agent(base.BaseIntegrationTestCase): def setUp(self): neutron_conf = templates.NeutronConfTemplate() self.process_fixtures = resources.GroupFixture([ resources.OVSProcessFixture( name='neutron-ovs-1-agent', module='neutron.plugins.openvswitch.agent.ovs_neutron_agent', core_config=neutron_conf, plugin_config=templates.ML2ConfTemplate()), resources.ProcessFixture( name='neutron-l3-1-agent', core_config=neutron_conf, plugin_config=templates.ML2ConfTemplate()), ]) super(TestL3Agent, self).setUp(neutron_conf.path) def test_namespace_creation(self): uuid = uuidutils.generate_uuid() router = self.client.create_router( body={'router': {'name': 'router-test', 'tenant_id': uuid}}) network = self.client.create_network( body={'network': {'name': 'network-test', 'tenant_id': uuid}}) subnet = self.client.create_subnet( body={'subnet': {'name': 'subnet-test', 'tenant_id': uuid, 'network_id': network['network']['id'], 'cidr': '20.0.0.0/24', 'gateway_ip': '20.0.0.1', 'ip_version': 4, 'enable_dhcp': True}}) self.client.add_interface_router( router=router['router']['id'], body={'subnet_id': subnet['subnet']['id']}) ns_name = "qrouter-%s" % router['router']['id'] ip = ip_lib.IPWrapper('sudo', ns_name) resources.wait_until(lambda: ip.netns.exists(ns_name)) self.client.remove_interface_router( router=router['router']['id'], body={'subnet_id': subnet['subnet']['id']}) self.client.delete_subnet(subnet['subnet']['id']) self.client.delete_network(network['network']['id']) self.client.delete_router(router['router']['id'])

commit_message:
Add jenkins integration

Change-Id: Ic75c87844633a7e68e54d772d26ab86fca8b4a46
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/solum-specs refs/changes/83/115283/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============== Jenkins Integration ============== Include the URL of your launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/solum/+spec/jenkins-integration This spec states how we will provide a way to integrate a Jenkins instance hosted externally with Solum. Solum Problem description =================== Solum aims to provide a CI/CD environment via its CI/CD workflows defined by "Solum pipelines". However if a end-user already uses Jenkins as piece of it's CI/CD workflow, we will provide a way to link his existing Jenkins installed on its own resources with Solum and its required OpenStack services. Proposed change =============== We will provide a plugin Jenkins which will: * produce a DU * deploy this DU to Glance * update glance id because this parameter will be needed by the pre-defined mistral action "deploy". (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/102327/6/specs/juno/workflow-stages.rst) Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- The jenkins plugin will use keystone auth Notifications impact -------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: pierre-padrixe Other contributors: related blueprints will be done by who ever picks up the work. Work Items ---------- plugin ^^^^^ - Make sure we can use the SDK for Jenkins plugin development in Python (https://github.com/jenkinsci/jenkins.py) - So The plugin will be able to use the builder code available to build a DU image - Then we will use glanceclient to upload the produced DU image to glance - And finally interact with solum pipelines / mistral in order to fill the image_id parameter of the mistral action "deploy" described in this spec (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/102327/6/specs/juno/workflow-stages.rst) Documentation Impact ==================== * We will need a new section in the documentation specifying how to use the plugin

commit_message:
Add rule overwrite flag to Enforcer class

* Add a flag to policy.Enforcer to control if rules read from policy
config file overwrite existing rule(s) in Enforcer object.

This requirement comes from Glance adoption. In Glance domain model,
before load policy configure file(s) (if needed - force or file update)
ProtectProperty logic domain provided may already added some rules
according to operator configure, so policy.Enforcer need to keep them
there instead of always overwrite them by configure files in any case.

* Fix a minor issue which causes use_conf flag loss once load_rules()
loaded rules from configure file(s), without this flag, when a configure
file got changed, reloading will not be triggered when calling
enforcer().

Change-Id: I6f552dcf37128668abc71f5804ff12902a0e1850
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

commit_message:
labs: sleep in shutdown_controller.sh

After building the cluster with the two additional snapshots on the
controller VM, we end up with a dying nova-compute service.

Sleeping 2+ seconds after booting into compute and before rebooting
controller fixes the problem: nova-compute keeps running and its status
in nova-manage service list will go to XXX and back to :-) without user
intervention.

Change-Id: I8ba20c77392b0966d6febfc300790cf1943f2ad5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/training-guides refs/changes/02/136702/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # At this point in the cluster build, we just rebooted the compute VM to take # a snapshot, and we are about to reboot the controller node for the same # purpose. # # About a minute after we reboot the controller, the status of nova-compute # (according to nova-manage service list) becomes "XXX". # # If we sleep for 2 seconds now, before rebooting the controller, the # nova-compute service on the compute node will keep running and the status # will automatically return to ":-)" after some time (may take several # minutes). If we don't sleep here, the nova-compute service on compute will # die within a few minutes (needs manual service restart or a compute node # reboot). sleep 2 echo "Shutting down the controller node."

commit_message:
Makes health return True or False

API returns a 204 for the health check with no body content.
The function should have returned  True if http result was a 204,
or else a False.

I solved the problem by making the function return false in case of an
error.

Change-Id: I02771f5aa61db4ed83da952245744cb3a6163a26
Closes-bug: #1288986

commit_message:
Avoid calling _parse_driver_info in every test

In test_seamicro.py file almost all the testcases are calling
_parse_driver_info. Ideally it should be set in setup only once.

Change-Id: Ic7daa4e8daec891380b1ead6824214abff28fbb6
Closes-Bug: #1394910

commit_message:
Fix for extra_specs KeyError

During _cold_migrate, there is a code path when
extra_specs is not present in the request_spec['instance_type']
bag. Identified one test case where removing extra_specs
causes the same error as reported in the bug below. We
just need to tolerate this by using a default value for pop()

Closes-Bug: #1394569

Change-Id: I9d4d02069322af1a1f0b84c1e86d2e586c6712d8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/47/136747/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: request_spec['instance_type'].pop('extra_specs', None)

commit_message:
Add empty id_rsa.pub for nailgun settings template

Commit 5106d31ee80a683c618fada7b0186263e1d20a28 adds a
nailgun dependency on /root/.ssh/id_rsa.pub, but docker
build fails because it doesn't exist during this phase.

Change-Id: Ib36adcebe188627ed62b24b81e708edafd52cdaf
Closes-Bug: #1392698
(cherry picked from commit b1d9d0946d8e311fa5f62f7fb6e3ec892ffef842)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-main refs/changes/92/135292/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #Workaround for nailgun settings.yaml template RUN mkdir -p /root/.ssh;chmod 700 /root/.ssh;touch /root/.ssh/id_rsa.pub;chmod 600 /root/.ssh/id_rsa.pub

commit_message:
Added some hacks to ensure lv creating success

* added vgremove right before vgcreate

* inserted udevadm settle before vgremove and vgcreate.
  this is for avoiding udev race when there are
  unhandled events in udev queue

Closes-Bug: 1373435
Change-Id: Ic764bb1722ac45b432fc7c476f6e418a3715ac8a

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-21 16:33:23.000000000', 'files': ['manilaclient/tests/unit/v1/test_shell.py', 'manilaclient/v1/shell.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-manilaclient/commit/82b564d3a0fa057ec99a50143b86df1c85179b68', 'message': "Fix snapshot-list filter key 'usage'

Manilaclient sends filter key 'usage' with snapshot-list request anytime.
But it is incompatible with juno version of Manila.
Make manilaclient avoid sending this key in case it is not specified
explicitly.

Change-Id: Iada90df5b88848cb4cdb78d1a550e726b8829428
Closes-Bug: #1394974
"}]
commit_message:
Fix snapshot-list filter key 'usage'

Manilaclient sends filter key 'usage' with snapshot-list request anytime.
But it is incompatible with juno version of Manila.
Make manilaclient avoid sending this key in case it is not specified
explicitly.

Change-Id: Iada90df5b88848cb4cdb78d1a550e726b8829428
Closes-Bug: #1394974

commit_message:
Update ironic pxe job names to reflect voting status

These jobs are named -nv but have been voting for a while in the places
they run, this updates them to reflect this. This also removes unneeded
postgres variations of the job from the all projects other than ironic.

Change-Id: Ib645b4547b36811f1342c0bd261f4ed877cab25b

commit_message:
Release 5.0.0 - Juno

Changes in this release:
* Added class to manage policy.json
* Changed the default value of the san_thin_provision parameter for eqlx
* Added database tuning parameters
* Made keystone user creation optional when creating a service
* Added ability to hide secrets from logs
* Added parameters for netapp and and cinder-api workers
* Corrected the package name for cinder backup
* Added support for the EMC VNX direct driver
* Migrated the mysql backend to use openstacklib::db::mysql
* Added support for availability zone

Change-Id: I08b059778354b9c2280501d8defa2e4884b8f3a7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-cinder refs/changes/64/136664/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 5.0.0 - 2014.2.0 - Juno**5.0.0** * Stable Juno release * Added class to manage policy.json * Changed the default value of the san_thin_provision parameter for eqlx * Added database tuning parameters * Made keystone user creation optional when creating a service * Added ability to hide secrets from logs * Added parameters for netapp and and cinder-api workers * Corrected the package name for cinder backup * Added support for the EMC VNX direct driver * Migrated the mysql backend to use openstacklib::db::mysql * Added support for availability zones **4.2.0** * Added parameters to set cinder volume driver * Added class for extended logging options * Added option to specify endpoint protocol * Fixed cinder type path issues * Added option to specify cinder volume path * Fixed targetcli package dependency on target service * Fixed os version fact comparison for RedHat-based operating systems for specifying service provider * Added option to configure os_region_name in the cinder config **4.1.0** * Added Cinder v2 endpoint support. * Added SSL support for Cinder API. * Added RabbitMQ SSL support. * Moved default_volume_type to cinder::api * Removed warnings for existing Cinder volumes. * Pinned major gems.

added_lines: This repository includes the Tempest and DevStack projects. The structure of the repository is as follows:: devstack/1. Create a blueprint stub in ``tempest`` or ``devstack`` blueprint repository in the commit message. DevStack specs should go into the ``devstack/`` subdirectory but otherwise follow the same process.5. Review happens on proposal by qa-core or devstack-core members as applicable, and othersTempest Specs For New Tests =========================== DevStack Specs ============== Specs for DevStack fall into a couple of broad categories: * Support for new {project|driver|cool widget} This is where the discussion of "Does this support belong in the DevStack repo?" should take place. * Significant re-factoring One primary section that these types of changes require is an analysis of backward compatibility and Grenade impacts. The existing template is mostly suitable for DevStack use, a quick s/tempest/devstack/ handles the majority of changes.

commit_message:
Always match lowercase MAC

In some places we are making comparisons between MACs
from different sources like:
* from DB - those are lowercase strings
* from other inputs - where we do not know if MAC will
  be lowercase, uppercase (or mixed) string
We need to always lowercase string in DB queries.

Also new utils function was created: is_same_mac to compare
if MACs are equal. It uses netaddr.EUI internally.

Change-Id: Idae5bc6009f857e72712afac04ffe174e73c7a87
Closes-Bug: #1394466

added_lines: def test_nic_mac_swap(self): mac_eth0 = '00:11:22:dd:ee:ff' mac_eth1 = 'aa:bb:cc:33:44:55' eth0 = { 'name': 'eth0', 'mac': mac_eth0, 'current_speed': 1, 'state': 'up' } eth1 = { 'name': 'eth1', 'mac': mac_eth1, 'current_speed': 1, 'state': 'up' } # prepare metadata with our interfaces meta = self.env.default_metadata() self.env.set_interfaces_in_meta(meta, [eth0, eth1]) # NOTE(prmtl) hack to have all mac set as we want # crete_node() will generate random mac for 1st iface # if we will not set it like that node_mac = meta['interfaces'][0]['mac'] node = self.env.create_node(api=True, meta=meta, mac=node_mac) self.env.create_cluster(api=True, nodes=[node['id']]) resp = self.app.get( reverse('NodeNICsHandler', kwargs={'node_id': node['id']}), headers=self.default_headers) original_nic_info = resp.json # swap macs, make them uppercase to check that we handle that correctly eth0['mac'], eth1['mac'] = eth1['mac'].upper(), eth0['mac'].upper() # update nodes with swapped macs new_meta = self.env.default_metadata() self.env.set_interfaces_in_meta(new_meta, [eth0, eth1]) node_data = {'mac': node['mac'], 'meta': new_meta} self.app.put( reverse('NodeAgentHandler'), jsonutils.dumps(node_data), headers=self.default_headers) # check that networks are assigned to the same interfaces resp = self.app.get( reverse('NodeNICsHandler', kwargs={'node_id': node['id']}), headers=self.default_headers) updated_nic_info = resp.json for orig_iface in original_nic_info: updated_iface = next( iface for iface in updated_nic_info if iface['mac'] == orig_iface['mac']) self.assertEqual( orig_iface['assigned_networks'], orig_iface['assigned_networks']) # nic names were swapped self.assertNotEqual(orig_iface['name'], updated_iface['name'])

commit_message:
Add heartbeat driver internal API

Some drivers can have to do a heartbeat to detect connection lost
quickly. This change adds a new internal driver API that will be used
by the executor to do the heartbeat, the default implementation of the
heartbeat is a no-op, each driver can reimplements this method to do
additionnal actions, when heartbeat occurs.

Related-Bug: #856764
Related-Bug: #1371723

Change-Id: I1d0200d6d6ed0fd76572c38b2d06aa82a678362d

commit_message:
RabbitMQ heartbeat implementation

AMQP offers a heartbeat feature to ensure that the application layer
promptly finds out about disrupted connections (and also completely
unresponsive peers). If the client requests heartbeats on connection, rabbit
server will regularly send messages to each connections with the
expectation of a response.

Change-Id: I971f6146ed73d8e1a11dcb4012b40676addb3991
Co-Authored-By: Oleksii Zamiatin <ozamiatin@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ilya Pekelny<ipekelny@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Redeploy controllers in case ceph-osd added to cluster

Ceph-osd relies on ceph-mon that installed on controllers,
in case controllers were deployed first, without any ceph-osd,
ceph-mon wont be present

If user will try to deploy ceph-osd afterwards - deployment
will fail, because ceph-osd wont be able to connect to ceph-mon
Right now the only option is to reconfigure controllers
in case ceph-osd added to cluster, after introducing granular
deployment it will be possible to execute only necessery task

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: 1388798
Closes-Bug: 1362601

Change-Id: I12e3a2e65d2a08d07f8a0b2845a232695477c587

commit_message:
Add Support for Keystone V3 CLI

This change allows user domains and tenant/project domains to
be specified through CLI.

commit_message:
Release 5.0.0 - Juno

Changes in this release:
* Added ceilometer::policy to control policy.json
* Fixed bug in glance_image type
* Added parameter os_region_name to glance::api
* Added support for vSphere datastore backend
* Updated the calls to the glance command-line utility
* Added parameter swift_store_large_object_size to glance::backend::swift
* Bumped stdlib dependency to >=4.0.0
* Added parameter command_options to glance::cache::cleaner and glance::cache::pruner
* Added parameter package_ensure to glance::backend::rbd
* Added parameter manage_service to various classes
* Added parameters to control whether to configure users
* Migrated the glance::db::mysql class to use openstacklib::db::mysql and deprecated the mysql_module parameter
* Added parameter registery_client_protocol to glance::api
* Fixed ssl parameter requirements for kombu and rabbit

Change-Id: I5dcce1d748602dd46d409d51523b96a51709d285
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-glance refs/changes/65/136665/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 5.0.0 - 2014.2.0 - Juno**5.0.0** * Stable Juno release * Added ceilometer::policy to control policy.json * Fixed bug in glance_image type * Added parameter os_region_name to glance::api * Added support for vSphere datastore backend * Updated the calls to the glance command-line utility * Added parameter swift_store_large_object_size to glance::backend::swift * Bumped stdlib dependency to >=4.0.0 * Added parameter command_options to glance::cache::cleaner and glance::cache::pruner * Added parameter package_ensure to glance::backend::rbd * Added parameter manage_service to various classes * Added parameters to control whether to configure users * Migrated the glance::db::mysql class to use openstacklib::db::mysql and deprecated the mysql_module parameter * Added parameter registery_client_protocol to glance::api * Fixed ssl parameter requirements for kombu and rabbit **4.2.0** * Added ability to hide secret type parameters from logs **4.1.0** * Added multiple rabbit hosts support. * Added image_cache_dir parameter. * Deprecated old SQL parameters. * Fixed the Glance add_image parser for new client. * Fixed values in get_glance_image_attrs. * Fixed 'could not find user glance' bug. * Pinned major gems.

commit_message:
Add only last atop log to snapshot

To minimize the size of Diagnostic snapshot only last atop log will be
added

Related bug: #1389155
This patch should be merged after Ib46ad049bc523f120da1ddaf20fb63a7b135153

Change-Id: I7806a13ff0534f9d139cae27aaf866b3fab11731

commit_message:
Drop RpcProxy usage from LBaaS code

Update the LBaaS code to stop using the RpcProxy compatibility class.
The equivalent direct usage of oslo.messaging APIs are now used
instead.

Part of blueprint drop-rpc-compat.

Change-Id: I381394507e4f2daf6d774f70087fef8833c9bab5

commit_message:
move nova-tox-functional to experimental until there is content

I had hoped to have content in here already, but I don't. So lets make
this experimental to save test nodes until there is valuable results
coming back from it.

Change-Id: Ib0384333528a6bf7fe01d4b542c5acf6f7a3f153

commit_message:
Enable filter alarms by their type

Since type is a very important attribute for alarm object, it will be much
convenient to get alarms by certain type. This patch adds the 'alarm_type'
parameter to get_alarms interface to implement it.

End user can filter alarms by using 'type' filter.

NOTE: this patch changes the parameter 'type' to 'alarm_type' in
get_alarm_changes interface of storage module, to keep consistent with
get_alarm interface.

Change-Id: Ib81375028957490f3a114de7627bc4bcb20f3d77
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/58/93658/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add new notifications types for volumes/snapshots

This change allows to collect and view notifications of different types -
volume/snapshot.(create | delete | update).(start | end) and
volume.(resize | attach | detach).(start | end).

Implements: blueprint add-new-notifications-types-for-volumes-and-snapshots
Change-Id: I592605bcea483d06f219a4d02d3a70a9fc0e27a3

added_lines: volume_crud = ceilometer.volume.notifications:VolumeCRUD snapshot_crud = ceilometer.volume.notifications:SnapshotCRUD

commit_message:
Replacing data_processing with data-processing

Using data_processing causes a problem when defining the endpoint
statically in keystone.

Change-Id: I8fb2be802c4390bdcd49e1722cd36f50781b1feb
Partial-bug: #1356053

commit_message:
Migrate haproxy to svc-map

This patch migrates the haproxy element from map-services to
svc-map by adding a svc-map file and adding the -a option to
the call to os-svc-enable.

Change-Id: Ib01a14cfb61eafb0ba3e484ae2a7d441d242b330

commit_message:
Updated email notification

Change-Id: I7e8482b8c1f908ebe505a2f85eeca8397a12b9bf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-notification refs/changes/58/130958/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines:
import json import re def _create_msg(self, hostname, notification): """ Create two kind of messages: 1. Notifications that include metrics with a hostname as a dimension 2. Notifications that do not include metrics and therefore no hostname. * A third notification type which include metrics but do not include a hostname will be treated as type #2. """ if len(hostname) != 0: msg = email.mime.text.MIMEText("On host "%s" %s

Alarm "%s" transitioned to the %s state at %s UTC" % (hostname, notification.message.lower(), notification.alarm_name, notification.state, time.asctime(time.gmtime(notification.alarm_timestamp))) + \ "
alarm_id: %s" % notification.alarm_id) msg['Subject'] = "%s "%s" for Host: %s" % (notification.state, notification.alarm_name, hostname) else: msg = email.mime.text.MIMEText("%s

Alarm "%s" transitioned to the %s state at %s UTC
Alarm_id: %s" % (notification.message, notification.alarm_name, notification.state, time.asctime(time.gmtime(notification.alarm_timestamp)), notification.alarm_id )) msg['Subject'] = "%s "%s" " % (notification.state, notification.alarm_name) msg['From'] = self.email_config['from_addr'] msg['To'] = notification.address return msg # Get the "hostname" from the notification message if there is one if "hostname" in notification.message: hostname = re.search('hostname=(.+?)\}', notification.message).group(1) else: hostname = '' # Generate the message msg = self._create_msg(hostname, notification) # email the notification
deleted_lines:
msg = email.mime.text.MIMEText("%s
Alarm %s transitioned to the %s state at %s UTC
Full Data:
%s" % (notification.message, notification.alarm_name, notification.state, time.asctime(time.gmtime(notification.alarm_timestamp)), notification.to_json())) msg['Subject'] = '%s: %s' % (notification.state, notification.alarm_name) msg['From'] = self.email_config['from_addr'] msg['To'] = notification.address

added_lines: select a.state from alarm as a inner join alarm_definition as ad on ad.id = a.alarm_definition_id where ad.tenant_id = %s and a.id = %s""" cursor.execute(select_query, (tenant_id, id)) if state != prev_state: parms = [state, tenant_id, id] update_query = """ update alarm set state = %s where alarm.id in (select distinct id from (select distinct alarm.id from alarm inner join alarm_definition on alarm_definition.id = alarm.alarm_definition_id where alarm_definition.tenant_id = %s and alarm.id = %s) as tmptable )""" cursor.execute(update_query, parms)

Rename rally-scenarios to rally-jobs & add readme

This patch renames misleading rally-scenarios to rally-jobs.
rally-jobs describes much better purpose of this directory

Add readme files that describes structure and meanings of files
and directories
