revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-24 12:23:28.000000000', 'files': ['specs/kilo/consolidate_extensions.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-specs/commit/0f4e434ff01cc33ba8d4eecc1e392b3cdb2380c2', 'message': 'Spec for consolidating neutron exts into core

DocImpact
ApiImpact

Change-Id: I70e76e427b2126c83ab8c0b2f8ae92006ff861ae
'}]
commit_message:
Spec for consolidating neutron exts into core

DocImpact
ApiImpact

Change-Id: I70e76e427b2126c83ab8c0b2f8ae92006ff861ae
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-specs refs/changes/45/136745/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== Consolidate Neutron extensions ========================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/neutron/+spec/consolidate-extensions The goal of this blueprint is to simplify Neutron extensions redefining the concept of "core" Neutron API. The expected benefits are: * Stopping extensions nonsenses. Several extensions indeed implement features so critical that Neutron could not interact with Nova. * Providing a consolidate view of the API. Currently extensions, and in particular "attribute extensions", are causing the API to look different from deployment to deployment. * Simplyfing DB management code. Condensing extensions into core will allow us for squashing together a few DB mixing, such as those for L3 DB management * Paving the way for microversioning; moving away from extension is indeed a necessary step for introducing API evolution through versioning Problem Description =================== Currently Neutron defines 26 extensions in the neutron.extensions package, plus a number of vendor-specific extensions in the various vendor plugin packages. Some of these extensions, such as load balancing, or IPSEC VPN, actually implement additional services which might or might not be part of a Neutron service offering. However, most of the currently defined extensions in reality represent an evolution of the core API defined for the Folsom release. Extension such as 'router' and 'securitygroups' actually implement Neutron's core functionality. The notion that Neutron can be as simple as a service providing bare L2 connectivity is indeed obsolete. Even if the number of available extensions is not overwhelming, this already causes some problems to API consumers. Since the structure of requests and responses can change from deployment to deployment, achieving portable applications which make use of the Neutron API is rather difficult. By "portable" here we mean applications which can be used against different OpenStack API providers. Moreover, API evolution through extension is an approach that tends to become confusion and hard to maintain in the long term, even if results very practical in the short term as it avoids versioning. Situations in which one needs to extend an extensions are indicative of a condition where this approach is already being abused. Proposed Change =============== Many of the extensions currently defined will become part of the core Neutron API. The implementation section lists the extensions which will become part of the core API. This section only discusses impact on plugins and ML2 drivers. Impact for end users and deployers is discussed in the appropriate section. The aim of this change is not to force plugin and drivers to implement things that nowadays are considered optional. Therefore, plugin and driver maintainers will not need to ensure they implement all the extensions which will be moved into core - even if it would be really nice if they did. However of the current neutron extensions, such as security groups or L3, must be supplied by every deployment. On the other hand some extension, such as "external gateway modes" or "dvr" represents features which might or might not be enabled in a given deployment. Plugins and drivers won't be required to implement these optional features, altough the relevant attributes will be part of the core API. From a plugin maintainer perspective this will imply that: * Only a handful of the current extensions will stay as such and will need to be declared in the "supported extensions" list. * Features which a plugin might optionally support will be listed in a "supported features" list. This will include things like dvr, external gateway modes, or dhcp options. The plugin or driver can safely ignore optional features it does not support. * There will be no change to the authorization model for what currently are "extended" attributes. This will be addressed with a separate blueprint. * The mixin approach, albeit another candidate for overhauling, will not be touched as part of this blueprint. However, some mixins might be "coalesced" as a part of this process. This will have no impact on plugin and drivers, beyond probably changing the name of the mixin the plugin implements * Out of tree plugins might be negatively impacted by this change. For them the advise is to get in touch with Neutron developers on the mailing list to work towards a smooth transition. The changes proposed with this specification are actually only the first step towards API micro-versioning, which has already been approved for Nova_. Once the API is consolidated into "core" and "service extensions", the next step will be to introduce a versioning strategy for all of them and defining rules for ensuring backward compatibility. However, factoring in other API layer items such as the switch to Pecan_, it is safer to stage the introduction of a new API evolution strategy and realistically it might not be possible to introduce micro versioning in the Kilo release cycle. Finally, while this plan is implemented it is also likely that new extensions will be proposed and approved for the Kilo release cycle. Keepign approving new extensions might not be the sanest thing to do when there is a consensus on moving away from extension as a strategy for evolving the API. To this aim: * Extensions proposing an additional, optional, service which does not alter any resource of the core API might be approved. * Extension enabling optional features on existing resources, and exposing them through the API should be evaluated on a case-by-case basis. These extensions, if approved, will become part of the core API. Approval criteria are out of scope for this specification * No change will be made to plugin specific extensions, even when they actually are attribute extensions, mostly for preventing the scope of this specification from becoming too large. In a subsequent iteration plugin specific attribute extensions will become plugin specific features. Note: the proposed change does not affect at all the current extension loading mechanism. The Pecan_ switch activity might however have a non negligible impact on it. Additional note: This proposal does not discuss the impact of this change on RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTE_MAP, since the Pecan_ switch activity is going to radically change the way in which API resources are defined. Data Model Impact ----------------- We do not expect any change in the Neutron data model. REST API Impact --------------- This change will introduce a new URI for retrieving enabled features. In other words this will be the URI to retrieve the list of optional feature which were previously availabe under the 'extensions' URI. A feature item will have the following structure: +------------+-------+---------+---------+------------+-------------------+ |Attribute |Type |Access |Default |Validation/ |Description | |Name | | |Value |Conversion | | +============+=======+=========+=========+============+===================+ |name |string |RO, all |N/A |string |short name | | | | | | | | +------------+-------+---------+---------+------------+-------------------+ |description |string |RO, all |'' |N/A |a relatively | | | | | | |short description | | | | | | |of what this | | | | | | |feature does | +------------+-------+---------+---------+------------+-------------------+ |enabled |boolean|RO, all |N/A |true/false |True if the feature| | | | | | |is enable in the | | | | | | |current deployment | +------------+-------+---------+---------+------------+-------------------+ The /extensions URI will still be available, and it will list those extensions which are orthogonal to the neutron core API (eg: load balancing) It is also important to note that this change will also change the structure of all the resources for which an 'attribute extension' is being moved into the core API. So far is the deployment did not support a given extension, the attribute was not present at all. This caused a resource to have a different 'shape' according to which extensions were enabled. With these change, resources will always have the same shape, but attributes for optional features, such as 'distributed' in the 'router' resource, will be set to a 'null' or 'N/A' value in responses if the feature is disabled; on the other hand if they're specified in requests, and the corresponding feature is disabled a 501 error code will be returned. This approach is preferrable over blindly ignoring attributes for disabled features. Security Impact --------------- The proposed change does not change the way in which APIs are consumed nor it changes the way in which APIs are dispatched to the plugins. We therefore do not expect this change to have any security impact. Notifications Impact -------------------- None Other End User Impact --------------------- The API change will be reflected into the CLI. It is important to note that applications relying on querying the 'extensions' URI for feature discovery, including Nova, might be affected by this change. In this case a transitory solution for the Kilo release cycle might be devised, or critical consumers (such as Nova) might be appropriately patched. Performance Impact ------------------ None. Other Deployer Impact --------------------- With this change the core API, and therefore the set of mandatory features that every Neutron deployment must expose, will change. Even if there should not be any deployment which does not provide capabilities such as security groups or floating IPs, it is really difficult to make any assertion about how deployers run OpenStack components. For this reason while this change will introduce a "kill switch" that will terminate the service at startup if the mandatory features cannot be made available, this switch will be made optional with a configuration variable. Developer Impact ---------------- The impact for plugin maintainers has already been discussed in the "Proposed Change" section. No further impact is expected. Community Impact ---------------- This change might impact teams which are proposing to introduce new API extensions for the Kilo release cycle. It might also concern community members whose opinion is actually that extensions are the best way to evolve the API. Alternatives ------------ This section discusses alternatives under the assumption that there is consensus about the fact that extensions are not anymore a viable way of evolving the API. A simple alternative approach is to no do anything, but simply document which extensions should be considered part of the core API. However, as there is no way to actually enforce a different API core, this will just increase the chances that actual deployments of the Neutron service provide an API which diverges from the documentation. Another possible alternative is to only a first iteration including into the core the minimal set of extensions which are required for Neutron to work smoothly with Nova. This list will include the l3 extension, the security group one, and possibly a few others. The advantage of this alternative is too have a smoother transition process. However, since the extension approach would still be the way to evolve the Neutron API, it would not fulfill the goal of paving the way for introducing an approach based on API versioning. Implementation ============== The list below discusses which extensions will be made part of the core Neutron API: * agent Admin extension for managing agents Fold into core, mandatory * allowedaddresspairs Relax anti spoof rules on ports fold into core, optional feature * dhcpagentscheduler schedule networks on dhcp agents fold into core, mandatory * dvr Dsitributed virtual router fold into core, optional feature * external_net router:external attribute fold into core, mandatory * extra_dhcp_opt custom dhcp options on ports fold into core, optional feature * extraroute router static routes fold into core, mandatory * firewall edge firewal keep as extension * flavor specific to meta plugin make 3rd party specific, it should not even be here * l3 routers and floating ips fold into core, mandatory * l3_ext_gw_mode control ability of doing SNAT at the gateway fold into core, optional feature * l3_ext_ha_mode create HA router fold into core, optional feature * l3agentscheduler schedule routers on l3 agents fold into core, mandatory * lbaas_agentscheduler schedule vips on lb agents keep as extension * loadbalancer load balancing keep as extension * metering label based bandwidth metering fold into core, optional feature (^) * multiprovidernet like provider, but with multiple bindings fold into core, optional feature * portbindings admin extension for exchangina info and capabilities about ports fold into core, mandatory * portsecurity enable/disable antispoof capabities on a port or network fold into core, optional feature (^^) * providernet provider networks fold into core, optional feature (^^^) * quotasv2 quota management fold into core, mandatory * routedserviceinsertion attach services to routers consider removal or make it plugin specific * routerservicetype specifies which type of router should be implemented consider removal or make it plugin specific * security groups control access to ports fold into core, mandatory * service type select driver for adv services keep as extension * vpnaas IPSEC VPN keep as extension ^ this is a service plugin but conceptually the functionality makes sense as part of the core neutron API ^^ pending progress on the relevant ML2 blueprint. Otherwise it will become plugin specific ^^^ there should be no difference in the new core between provider and multiprovider Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: salvatore-orlando Other contributors: <your naam here> Work Items ---------- * Introduce 'features' URI * Make chosen extensions part of the core API * Revisit DB mixin and coalesce where possible (eg: external gw modes) Dependencies ============ Ideally this change should depend on the Pecan switch. Implementing this blueprint with the current WSGI framework will just mean that we'll have to do the work again once the switch to Pecan occurs. Testing ======= This specification does not change the testing surface, if not for the addition of the 'features' URI for which appropriate unit and functional tests will be provided. However, this Documentation Impact ==================== User Documentation ------------------ Significant changes in the API reference documentation. Finally most of the extension appendix will go away. The need for these changes should actually seen as something good. Developer Documentation ----------------------- We would need to document the introduction of the supported_features variable. Trouble is that our developer documentation is so poor that at the moment there is not even a place where this can be stated. References ========== .. _Nova: API micro versioning specification (approved) http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/kilo/approved/api-microversions.html .. _Pecan: Neutron WSGI framework replacement with Pecan (link tbd)

commit_message:
Support query filtering for templates and EDP objects

Allow query params to be passed through the REST API for the
following objects:

* cluster templates
* node group templates
* data sources
* jobs
* job executions
* job binaries
* job binary internals

Suppress an exception when invalid filter fields are used,
simply return empty list.

Change-Id: Ie94a25fb0861cd78589983c6a6c7f36b50598b39

commit_message:
Update sahara endpoint type to avoid underscore

"data_processing" -> "data-processing"

Using data_processing causes a problem when defining the endpoint
statically in keystone.

Note: it should be merged only when there will be sahara python
client release available with I8fb2be802c4390bdcd49e1722cd36f50781b1feb

Change-Id: I473bef217cc9d8a71fca900a5fbd276e7719846f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/35/136735/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Support query filtering for cluster objects

The cluster_get_all implementation already supports query
parameters internally, but it is not exposed to the UI. Allow
query params to be passed in from the UI. Suppress an exception
when invalid filter fields are used, simply return empty list.
This will be a model for adding filtering to all x_list() methods
in the API.

Partial-implements: blueprint enable-result-filtering
Change-Id: I20a0de3056bb17cee2d55d87a61b2e23b9c4b657

commit_message:
Fix MemberListToMap ValueError with empty list

When parameter with type CommaDelimitedList has
Default value '' and MemberListToMap get member list
like reference to this parameter, it get [u''].
MemberListToMap do wrong parsing of this value: it
should return {} instead of ValueError.

Change-Id: Iaf4bd796fa93d4176afd16de36869375d8a773c4

Establish sphinx build structure

Set up sphinx to convert the specs to HTML and create an empty specs
directory to hold proposed specifications.

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-21 19:39:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements/commit/8e246dba09b772708be4918b23a4f31e629e7075', 'message': 'Set lock_path in cinder.conf

Without this set, interprocess locking does not work properly.

For the time being the value is being set in both the default
group and the oslo_concurrency group so we can seamlessly remove
the temprevert of the Cinder oslo.concurrency migration.  Once that
is done we can remove the one in the default group.

Change-Id: Idcabf808d5f7255d0cc382b7857a4c13b9b7a2dc
Closes-Bug: 1394963
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-11-24 10:52:44.000000000', 'files': ['elements/cinder/os-apply-config/etc/cinder/cinder.conf', 'elements/cinder/install.d/73-cinder'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements/commit/accd4ac96df9abfda20426a662595ad168ae6ceb', 'message': 'Set lock_path in cinder.conf

Without this set, interprocess locking does not work properly.

We also need to ensure the cinder state directory is writable
by cinder, up to now it was not.
Change-Id: Idcabf808d5f7255d0cc382b7857a4c13b9b7a2dc
Closes-Bug: 1394963
'}]
commit_message:
Set lock_path in cinder.conf

Without this set, interprocess locking does not work properly.

We also need to ensure the cinder state directory is writable
by cinder, up to now it was not.
Change-Id: Idcabf808d5f7255d0cc382b7857a4c13b9b7a2dc
Closes-Bug: 1394963
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/72/136472/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # TODO(bnemec): This is deprecated in the default group. # Remove it as soon as CI is no longer reverting the Cinder # change to oslo.concurrency. lock_path = /mnt/state/var/lib/cinder[oslo_concurrency] lock_path = /mnt/state/var/lib/cinder

commit_message:
Enforce log hints in neutron.services.loadbalancer

This change enforces log hints use and removes debug level log
translation, modifications are validated through a hacking rule and
the change respects loggging guidelines.

Validate that hacking rules apply to directories:
    - neutron/services/loadbalancer

Change-Id: I5f2a1a8861728399f3852fc9704eb160c35f7f8d
Partial-bug: #1320867

commit_message:
Fix package name for Fedora-based distributions

The current documentation describe a dependency with libqp-dev
package. This package name can be a misstyped libpq-dev, that
is named postgresql-devel in Fedora-based distributions.

This also happends with libmysqlclient-dev, that is mysql-devel
in Fedora.

Change-Id: Ibc0eed6c27643fbb9d6594688c3c5dd7165b9d58
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/78/124778/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sudo yum install python-devel openssl-devel python-pip git libmysqlclient-dev postgresql-libs
deleted_lines: sudo yum install python-devel openssl-devel python-pip git libmysqlclient-dev libqp-dev

commit_message:
Change time policy to eliminate time drift

At the moment we use the following structure:

<clock offset='utc'>
  <timer name='hpet' present='no'/>
</clock>

To elimintate time drift between virtual instances we are changing
structure to:

<clock offset='utc'>
  <timer name='rtc' tickpolicy='catchup' track=guest'>
    <catchup threshold='123' slew='120' limit='10000/>
  </timer>
  <timer name='pit' tickpolicy='delay'/>
  <timer name='hpet' present='no'/>
</clock>

Change-Id: I3e00e7cfb11584d484665a9872ee59318e7209e7
Closes-Bug: 1394546

Print Cloudera manager logs if integration test failed

Change-Id: I554b136e5a465d2dc43011eb2757472b6be97d96
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara refs/changes/19/133519/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines:
import six self._success = False #self._success = True def print_manager_log(self): manager_node = None for ip, processes in six.iteritems(self.cluster_info['node_ip_list']): if 'MANAGER' in processes: manager_node = ip break if not manager_node: print("Cloudera Manager node not found") self.open_ssh_connection(manager_node, self) try: log = self.execute_command('sudo cat /var/log/cloudera-scm-server/' 'cloudera-scm-server.log')[1] finally: self.close_ssh_connection() print("

CLOUDERA MANAGER LOGS

") print(log) print("

END OF CLOUDERA MANAGER LOGS

") def tearDown(self): if not self._success: self.print_manager_log()

commit_message:
Removes ISO image if found corrupt

This patch automatically removes the corrupt
ISO image if md5sum doesn't match and prompts
user to re-run osbash script as oppose to asking
the user to remove the corrupt image.

Change-Id: I0dae5d7b88980a5644ec684f8cc8f04697f06e8b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/training-guides refs/changes/56/136256/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: echo >&2 "ISO image is corrupt." echo >&2 "Removing the ISO image." rm ${IMG_DIR}/ubuntu-14.04.1-server-amd64.iso echo >&2 "Please re-run osbash script"
deleted_lines: echo >&2 "failed." echo >&2 "Aborting. Please fix or remove the ISO image."

commit_message:
TEMPEST: refactor error handling while installation

Tempest installation doesn't contain enough information for debugging
errors, which can be occured during installation.

This patch adds:
 - logging failed command and its output to:
   `rally.verification.verifiers.tempest.tempest.check_output`;
 - handling TempestSetupFailure in validation tempest scenarios;
 - fix in hacking check for logging module.

Change-Id: Ida723c6898cb6845459169f387ca36bf280fb644

commit_message:
Remove Mock class monkey patching

Replace use of Mock with Mock(). The Mock class was being modified and
so affecting other tests where Mock is used. An instance of the Mock
class is now used to keep the tests isolated.

Change-Id: Iccab8430d5814258c8c2d1f9af015bce999549bc
Closes-Bug: #1286245

commit_message:
Add support for running tests against standalone Heat

This replicates what is in heatclient shell.
We need support for the OS_NO_CLIENT_AUTH.

Change-Id: I40990555f072d3e10db704c0f63f19db9c8ed8bf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/65/136165/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import os endpoint = os.environ.get('HEAT_URL') if os.environ.get('OS_NO_CLIENT_AUTH') == 'True': token = None else: keystone = self._get_identity_client() token = keystone.auth_token try: if endpoint is None: endpoint = keystone.service_catalog.url_for( attr='region', filter_value=region, service_type='orchestration', endpoint_type='publicURL')
deleted_lines: keystone = self._get_identity_client() token = keystone.auth_token try: endpoint = keystone.service_catalog.url_for( attr='region', filter_value=region, service_type='orchestration', endpoint_type='publicURL')

Since 'IP address' argument is optional in the CLI command, it
should not be mandatory for the field "Specify a free IP address
from the selected subnet". This patch sets 'required=False' for

Change-Id: I112919d12ca3b4f40d9b907b7f47b64502d5ae7c

commit_message:
Make 'IP address' field optional for LBaaS VIP creation

Since 'IP address' argument is optional in the CLI command, it
should not be mandatory for the field "Specify a free IP address
from the selected subnet". This patch sets 'required=False' for
this field. Some LBaaS VIP test data cleanup is also done.

Closes-Bug: #1386616

Change-Id: I112919d12ca3b4f40d9b907b7f47b64502d5ae7c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/05/136305/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add few audit log messages to guestagent module

Few APIs were still missing log messages before calling RPC layer while
few others had multiple debug messages which I've squashed into single
log message.

commit_message:
Added specification for event log and logs improvements

blueprint event-log

Change-Id: I9faa7d99c40aecd194e4d70a4211960883aaed8a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara-specs refs/changes/52/119052/22 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================== Keep event log for cluster ========================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/sahara/+spec/event-log This specification proposes to add event logs assigned to cluster. Problem description =================== It will be more user friendly for have event log assigned to cluster. In this case user will have ability to see steps performed to deploy cluster and in case of some errors to see the reasons without reading sahara logs. Proposed change =============== New feature will provide the following ability: * For each cluster there will be an event log assigned to it. Deployer will have an ability to see it in Horizon. In that case he will have an ability to see all steps of cluster deploying. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- This change will require to write event log messages to database. REST API impact --------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Deployer impact --------------- This change will takes immediate effect after its merged. It's possible, that this change will add several config options. Developer impact ---------------- None Sahara-image-elements impact ---------------------------- None Sahara-dashboard / Horizon impact --------------------------------- This change will add section in horizon at page with event logs /data_processing/clusters/cluster_id. At this page it will be possible to see all event logs of choosen cluster. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: vgridnev Other contributors: slukjanov Work Items ---------- This feature require following modifications: * Add event logs to Sahara * Add unit test is Sahara for testing feature * Add modifications to Horizon/Data Processing section * Sahara docs should be updated with some use cases of this feature Dependencies ============ Depends on OpenStack requirements Testing ======= As written in Work Items section this feature will require unit tests Documentation Impact ==================== As written in Work Items section this feature will require docs updating with some use cases of feature References ==========

commit_message:
Remove module strutils,timeutils,importutis

We have used oslo.utils in cinder consumer code, and replaced
strutils,timeutils,importutis with oslo.utils. This commit
sync oslo-incubator consumer code and remove them.

Change-Id: I5b7ecaae45312d28e24f42585efbe6335b9d49f2

commit_message:
Rename marconi to zaqar

* projects.txt: The marconi project is now renamed to zaqar per
I8e587af588d9be0b5ebbab4b0f729b106a2ae537 so switching it here as
well to avoid breaking requirements proposals.

commit_message:
Replacing data_processing with data-processing

Sahara is changing the endpoint name from data_processing to
data-processing. The Sahara docs are updated here to reflect this
change.

Partial-bug: #1356053

commit_message:
transform samples only when transformers exist

the pipeline is oddly setup to loop through each sample and
attempt to transform it even when there are no transformers. this
is madness and should be stopped -- this patch does this.

at best, this should improve performance because of needless
looping, at worst, we get rid of misleading 'tranforming sample'
logs.

Change-Id: I80ba2b7775fda03670c7fa556ad5a779c6eefd27
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/22/135422/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if not self.transformers: transformed_samples = samples else: for sample in samples: LOG.debug(_( "Pipeline %(pipeline)s: Transform sample " "%(smp)s from %(trans)s transformer") % ({'pipeline': self, 'smp': sample, 'trans': start})) sample = self._transform_sample(start, ctxt, sample) if sample: transformed_samples.append(sample)
deleted_lines: for sample in samples: LOG.debug(_( "Pipeline %(pipeline)s: Transform sample " "%(smp)s from %(trans)s transformer") % ({'pipeline': self, 'smp': sample, 'trans': start})) sample = self._transform_sample(start, ctxt, sample) if sample: transformed_samples.append(sample)

commit_message:
Drop and recreate FK if adding new PK to routerl3bindings

Since MySQL 5.6 FK columns cannot be altered. As a workaround we can
drop the FK before ALTER COLUMN and then recreate it.

Change-Id: Icd1b3075cf29a6b0c477a4ddea2e6ebee91baef8
Closes-Bug: 1384555

commit_message:
Fix ntpd start on centos in cloud-init boothook

1) Add forgottent ntpd start into centos's cloud-init boothook.

2) Toggle ntp server on ubuntu to be sure it will start with correct
settings.

3) Fix typo in both boothook files
ntp(d) must be stopped before syncing date with ntpdate.

Change-Id: I4e8e912b61a57c84e24e13be10983654bcfec0ab
Closes-Bug: #1394617
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/65/136065/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Cache unscoped SAML tokens locally

Federation workflow is too expensive to repeat it for every OpenStack
operation. As long as session objects with saml2 cookies stored inside
are not reused between separate cli calls SAML auth plugins will cache
unscoped federated tokens.
This is a WIP patch proposing storing unencrypted and unsecured patches
as a local files (with permissions set to 0600).
Keyring was checked but it seems like this method also requires manual
password passing and is not suitable for a library use.

Change-Id: I6060f07980aeb34b5d949ccf36ce110ac3335867
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-keystoneclient refs/changes/06/134606/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import hashlib import json import logging import os import statLOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) def __init__(self, auth_url, **kwargs): super(_BaseSAMLPlugin, self).__init__(auth_url=auth_url, **kwargs) self.cache = kwargs.get('cache', False) @staticmethod def _path(filename, path): return '/'.join([path.rstrip('/'), hashlib.sha1(filename).hexdigest()]) def cache_unscoped_token(self, url, token, path='/tmp'): """Store unscoped federated token in a local filesystem. Tokens are stored in separate files. They are unencrypted and unsecured form. By default the file permisions are set to 0600. :param url: Service Provider URL, used for token identification :type url: string :param token: Token to be cached :type token: access.AccessInfoV3 :param path: Directory where the token file should be stored. Defaults to /tmp. :type path: string """ file_path = self._path(url, path) try: with open(file_path, 'w') as token_handler: os.chmod(file_path, stat.S_IREAD | stat.S_IWRITE) token_handler.write(json.dumps(token)) token_handler.flush() # The exception may happen often, so should be used for debugging # purposes only except IOError as e: LOG.debug(e) # Problem with reading file data, means caching didn't basically work except ValueError as e: LOG.warn(e) def fetch_unscoped_token(self, url, path='/tmp'): """Try retrieving unscoped federated token from a cached files. File names are built by concatenating temporary directory as well as sha1 endoced name of the url of the remote service from where token was retrieved, usually set to ``auth_url`` parameter. If token is missing or is going to be expired soon this method will return None indicating a new token should be generated. :param url: Service Provider URL, used for token identification :type url: string :param path: Directory where the token file should be stored. Defaults to /tmp. :type path: string :returns: V3 token :rtype: access.AccessInfoV3 """ file_path = self._path(url, path) token = None try: with open(file_path, 'r') as cache_file: token_json = json.loads(cache_file.read()) token = access.AccessInfoV3(token_json['auth_token'], **token_json) # The exception may happen often, so should be used for debugging # purposes only except IOError as e: LOG.debug(e) # Problem with reading file data, means caching didn't basically work except ValueError as e: LOG.warn(e) if token and not token.will_expire_soon(): return token return None auth_ref = self.get_cached_unscoped_auth_ref(session) def get_cached_unscoped_auth_ref(self, session, **kwargs): if self.cache: token = self.fetch_unscoped_token(self.auth_url) if token and not token.will_expire_soon(): return token token = self.get_unscoped_auth_ref(session, **kwargs) if self.cache: self.cache_unscoped_token(self.auth_url, token) return token

commit_message:
Force detach volume

There may be bad situation the volume is attached to a deleted instance,
in this case, we should force detach the instance from volume.
And force detach action is supported by cinder, it's will be helpful
to add this to cinderclient.

Change-Id: I6c2552fad0d8a203cdd7ecc1d1fedf3a6a33ec64
Closes-bug: #1386061
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-cinderclient refs/changes/43/131043/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @utils.arg('volume', metavar='<volume>', nargs='+', help='Name or ID of volume or volumes to force detach.') @utils.service_type('volumev2') def do_force_detach(cs, args): """Attempts force-detach of volume, regardless of state.""" failure_count = 0 for volume in args.volume: try: utils.find_volume(cs, volume).force_detach() except Exception as e: failure_count += 1 print("Detach for volume %s failed: %s" % (volume, e)) if failure_count == len(args.volume): raise exceptions.CommandError("Unable to force detach any of " "specified volumes.")

commit_message:
Add usage example to regenerate_repo_ubuntu

Just step-by-step instruction of how to add new packages to an
Ubuntu repository located on the CentOS node, and regenerate
repository indices after this.

Change-Id: Id9a6ff0132111bb5eb5c603881d1fedab83732b5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-main refs/changes/47/128847/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # # Example of the use of the script (For CentOS only. For Ubuntu, please use apt-ftparchive utility instead): # 1) Login to the CentOS node where the Ubuntu repository is located (Fuel master node, for example). # Your Ubuntu repository must have an './indices/' folder with correct # 'override.*' files for the repository. Fuel master node >=5.1 already has it. # 2) Copy additional packages to the Ubuntu repository if needed. # Please pay attention: this script works only with *.deb packages # located in the ./pool/main folder of the repository. # 3) yum install dpkg dpkg-devel # These packets can be taken from http://mirror.fuel-infra.org/fwm/ # # They are already in the Fuel master node starting from version >=5.1 # 4) Copy this script to the CentOS node to any location, for example to /tmp/regenerate_ubuntu_repo # 5) Set the path to the Ubuntu repository using the variable REPO_PATH and start the script: # REPO_PATH=/var/www/nailgun/ubuntu/x86_64 sh /tmp/regenerate_ubuntu_repo # 6) Done.

commit_message:
Add package support to ceilometer-alarm-notifier

Updates the ceilometer-alarm-notifier so that it supports
using distro packages via pkg-map and package-installs.
The default distro package is set to openstack-ceilometer-alarm
which on RHEL/Fedora contains the ceilometer-alarm-notifier
binary.

Also, includes the related svc-map configs so that the
packaged version of the systemd scripts work correctly.

Change-Id: I0f40e0e241d3cfa2f2c33164a871792fe1b0bee2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/45/134845/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add CLI multi tenancy tests

- Refactor CLI tests infrastructure
- Added auth in Mistral by two different users
- Removed tearDown methods, add usage of addCleanup methods
- Create new base methods like 'workbook-create', which contain
addCleanup call and makes tests more clear for reading

Implements: blueprint mistral-milti-tenancy-tests

Change-Id: I4a58b4c1bfff192912f3f1d149869656f7e9c54b

commit_message:
Add debug log when over quota exception occurs

There are some weird logs showed in bug 1353962, with
current logs we can't decide which part is wrong.
Add more logs will help operater to know the real reason
that make the quota exceed.

If this change makes too much log out, after bug 1353962
is fixed, we can talk about remove those logs, but currently
it will be helpful.

Change-Id: I2ab1fb62efc06b1cee213920539980e331870bf5
Related-Bug: #1353962
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/37/131737/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Fix connecting unnecessary iSCSI sessions issue
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-20 01:49:09.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/volume.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_volume.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/fb0de106f2f15604750bafc318ba06c41070cc35', 'message': 'Fix connecting unnecessary iSCSI sessions issue

In Icehouse with "iscsi_use_multipath=true", attaching a multipath
iSCSI volume may create unnecessary iSCSI sessions.

The iscsiadm discovery command in connect_volume() returns all of the
targets in the Cinder node, not just the ones related to the multipath
volume which is specified by iqn.  If the storage has many targets,
connecting to all these volumes will also result in many unnecessary
connections.

There are two types of iSCSI multipath devices.  One which shares
the same iqn between multiple portals, and the other which use
different iqns on different portals. connect_volume() needs to
identify the type by checking iscsiadm the output if the iqn is
used by multiple portals.

This patch changes the behavior of attaching volume:

   1. Identify the type by checking the iscsiadm output.
   2. Connect to the correct targets by connect_to_iscsi_portal().

Closes-Bug: #1382440

Change-Id: I488ad0c09bf26a609e27d67b9ef60b65bb45e0ad
'}]
commit_message:
Fix connecting unnecessary iSCSI sessions issue

In Icehouse with "iscsi_use_multipath=true", attaching a multipath
iSCSI volume may create unnecessary iSCSI sessions.

The iscsiadm discovery command in connect_volume() returns all of the
targets in the Cinder node, not just the ones related to the multipath
volume which is specified by iqn.  If the storage has many targets,
connecting to all these volumes will also result in many unnecessary
connections.

There are two types of iSCSI multipath devices.  One which shares
the same iqn between multiple portals, and the other which use
different iqns on different portals. connect_volume() needs to
identify the type by checking iscsiadm the output if the iqn is
used by multiple portals.

This patch changes the behavior of attaching volume:

   1. Identify the type by checking the iscsiadm output.
   2. Connect to the correct targets by connect_to_iscsi_portal().

Closes-Bug: #1382440

Change-Id: I488ad0c09bf26a609e27d67b9ef60b65bb45e0ad
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/12/135812/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_libvirt_kvm_volume_with_multipath_connecting(self): libvirt_driver = volume.LibvirtISCSIVolumeDriver(self.fake_conn) ip_iqns = [[self.location, self.iqn], ['10.0.2.16:3260', self.iqn], [self.location, 'iqn.2010-10.org.openstack:volume-00000002']] with contextlib.nested( mock.patch.object(os.path, 'exists', return_value=True), mock.patch.object(libvirt_driver, '_run_iscsiadm_bare'), mock.patch.object(libvirt_driver, '_get_target_portals_from_iscsiadm_output', return_value=ip_iqns), mock.patch.object(libvirt_driver, '_connect_to_iscsi_portal'), mock.patch.object(libvirt_driver, '_rescan_iscsi'), mock.patch.object(libvirt_driver, '_get_host_device', return_value='fake-device'), mock.patch.object(libvirt_driver, '_rescan_multipath'), mock.patch.object(libvirt_driver, '_get_multipath_device_name', return_value='/dev/mapper/fake-mpath-devname') ) as (mock_exists, mock_run_iscsiadm_bare, mock_get_portals, mock_connect_iscsi, mock_rescan_iscsi, mock_host_device, mock_rescan_multipath, mock_device_name): vol = {'id': 1, 'name': self.name} connection_info = self.iscsi_connection(vol, self.location, self.iqn) libvirt_driver.use_multipath = True libvirt_driver.connect_volume(connection_info, self.disk_info) # Verify that the supplied iqn is used when it shares the same # iqn between multiple portals. connection_info = self.iscsi_connection(vol, self.location, self.iqn) props1 = connection_info['data'].copy() props2 = connection_info['data'].copy() props2['target_portal'] = '10.0.2.16:3260' expected_calls = [mock.call(props1), mock.call(props2), mock.call(props1)] self.assertEqual(expected_calls, mock_connect_iscsi.call_args_list)

commit_message:
Make notifications use Instance.get_flavor()

This makes the notifications.info_from_instance() method use the
Instance.get_flavor() method to retrieve flavor information, instead
of assuming that it is in system_metadata. This requires that it is
passed an Instance object, so this patch also converts the code to
make that assumption (which needs doing anyway) and fixes remaining
dict-using callers to pass the object. This will be required by a
subsequent patch to refactor flavor storage.

Related to blueprint flavor-from-sysmeta-to-blob

Change-Id: I6e4e07807cb6cd173d54137d4fe8d9b1a0d49709
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/02/134302/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix exception handling in _get_host_metrics()

In resource_tracker.py, the exception path of _get_host_metrics()
misspells variable name 'monitor'. When exception occurs, this
misspelling prevents us to log warning message. This code change
corrects the misspelling.

Closes-Bug: 1394052

Change-Id: I8a99a4ceb53c89038e8b292a15ad9fd20daa4233
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/22/135322/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: LOG.warn(_("Cannot get the metrics from %s."), monitor)
deleted_lines: LOG.warn(_("Cannot get the metrics from %s."), monitors)

commit_message:
Improve vif attributes related with firewalling

This patch removes capability attribute and
adds following attributes.

- vif_security

vif_security has following child properties
- require_iptables: Neutron requires an external service to support iptables
- prevent_arp_spoofing: Neutron requires an external service to prevent arp spoofing
- prevent_mac_spoofing: Neutron requires an external service to prevent mac spoofing
- prevent_ip_spoofing: Neutron requires an external service to prevent ip spoofing
- prevent_dhcp_spoofing: Neutron requires an external service to prevent dhcp spoofing
- require_securitygroup: Neutron requires an external service to support security group

Closes-bug: #1112912
Change-Id: Ib9b68561e5d5a9a8c4767e32a91b354c1313259e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/46/21946/40 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: VIF_TYPE = portbindings.VIF_TYPE_BRIDGE VIF_SECURITY_EXPECTED = True SUPPORTED_FIREWALL_DRIVERS = [test_bindings.NO_FIREWALL, test_bindings.IPTABLES_FIREWALL]

subject: Further split ASG code.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-10-20 13:46:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/c6cde5b7cbe7b2f2f34b7a0eb8c60832012f6436', 'message': 'Further split ASG code.

This patch splits AWS and Heat version of AutoScalingGroups into
separate files and renames the autoscaling.py to instance_group.py.

commit_message:
Further split ASG code.

This patch splits AWS and Heat version of AutoScalingGroups into
separate files and renames the autoscaling.py to instance_group.py.

The ugly class hierarchy will be fixed in following patches.

Change-Id: I4b776e3f4b74df3e083fcc6f8ba583822ca16580
Implements: partial-blueprint reorg-asg-code

added_lines: from heat.engine.resources import instance_group as instgrp self.instance_group = instgrp.InstanceGroup('ig', defn, stack)
deleted_lines: from heat.engine.resources import autoscaling as asc self.instance_group = asc.InstanceGroup('ig', defn, stack)

commit_message:
Add Parallels Cloud Server support into virt/libvirt driver

This specification proposes to implement modification in
virt/libvirt driver to support Parallels Cloud Server
(http://www.parallels.com/products/pcs/).

blueprint pcs-support
Change-Id: Ibbc19ca2181827e7c6576f82f756898a13503f2e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/35/111335/13 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ===================================================== Parallels Cloud Server support in nova/libvirt driver ===================================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/pcs-support This specification proposes to make changes in nova/libvirt driver in order to support Parallels Cloud Server (http://www.parallels.com/products/pcs/). Problem description =================== Parallels Cloud Server (PCS) is a virtualization solution, which enables hosters to use container and hypervisor virtualization over the same API. PCS is supported by libvirt, but OpenStack can't use it because of some differences in domains configration and supported features. Proposed change =============== To implement this feature we need to make a set of small changes in nova/libvirt driver so that it will create PCS domains correctly. The end user will be able to configure nova to use PCS by setting libvirt.virt_type option to "parallels". Alternatives ------------ The alternate way is to use separate nova driver https://github.com/parallels/pcs-nova-driver pros: * There is no middle layer between OpenStack and PCS, pcs-nova-driver uses PCS's python API. * Changes in pcs-nova-driver will not affect nova/libvirt's code. * Nova uses a small set of virtualization API to run instances so it's more convenient to implement small driver in nova/virt directory (like xen or hyperv). cons: * It's hard to maintain out-of-tree driver. * pcs-nova-driver is unlikely to be accepted into nova's tree. Data model impact ----------------- None. REST API impact --------------- None. Security impact --------------- None. Notifications impact -------------------- None. Other end user impact --------------------- None. Performance Impact ------------------ None. Other deployer impact --------------------- In order to use PCS as Openstack compute node, deployer must install nova-compute packages on PCS node and set libvirt.virt_type config option to "parallels". Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: dguryanov Work Items ---------- To be filled Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= To be filled Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== Parallels Cloud Server: http://www.parallels.com/products/pcs/.

commit_message:
Using Barbican as secret backend

This specifications provides an alternate mechanism to store secret data
using Barbican.

Change-Id: Id1652f0026aee8ca752c87f6d0c06bd2b548eb5d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat-specs refs/changes/01/133501/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================================ Using Barbican as secret backend ================================ https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/barbican-as-secret-backend We store some secret data in the Heat database using a simple symmetric encryption with a static key. To improve security of the storage, we should optionally support using Barbican to store those secrets. Problem description =================== Heat uses a simple encrypt mechanism to store secret data in its database, with the key specified in the configuration. While it provides some security, a compromised Heat node will give the attacker access to all the users' secrets. Proposed change =============== Add a new flag to the Heat configuration specifying that Barbican must be used for storing secret. When set, Heat will query the service catalog for the Barbican service, and will store the secrets in the user project, with predictable prefixes. It should require a refactoring, as data encryption is today managed at the SQLAlchemy data layer, whereas it may be easier to manage it above, especially as we need user credentials to talk to Barbican. Alternatives ------------ There seems to be an effort to create a key management shim that may use local secure storage as an option. We may want to wait for that effort. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: therve Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: Kilo-1 Work Items ---------- * Extract encryption management from the SQLAlchemy layer * Move Barbican client out of contrib * Add a configuration option to send secrets to the Barbican service Dependencies ============ * We may want to wait on parameter encryption: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/encrypt-hidden-parameters

commit_message:
Add requirement for APIImpact flag

Adds a requirement for an APIImpact flag in
the commit message for a proposed spec if it proposes
changes to the Heat REST API. This will make it
much easier for people such as the API WG who want to
review API changes across OpenStack to find and
review proposed API changes.

Change-Id: I9d5775fb86fc06d343cb26d6d8cc3e00c5fd16cc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat-specs refs/changes/38/132338/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: If your specification proposes any changes to the Heat REST API such as changing parameters which can be returned or accepted, or even the semantics of what happens when a client calls into the API, then you should add the APIImpact flag to the commit message. Specifications with the APIImpact flag can be found with the following query: https://review.openstack.org/#/q/status:open+project:openstack/heat-specs+message:apiimpact,n,z

commit_message:
Add admin_metadata 'protected' for volume

Aim to enhance the protection for the volume to avoid deletion by mistake.
The volume can not be deleted until the 'protected' is setted to 'False'.

DocImpact: add a new feature about protected volume

Implements: blueprint protected-volume
Change-Id: Ia4c4bb3249b9e5240a7bd9fa80a85f30ad8712e6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/27/93227/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: volume_metadata = self.get_volume_admin_metadata(context, volume) if 'protected' in volume_metadata \ and volume_metadata['protected'] == 'True': # Volume is still protected, so it can't be deleted raise exception.VolumeProtected(volume_id=volume_id) def update_protected_flag(self, context, volume, flag): if volume['status'] not in ['available', 'in-use']: msg = _('Volume status must be available or in-use' ' to update protected flag.') raise exception.InvalidVolume(reason=msg) self.update_volume_admin_metadata(context.elevated(), volume, {'protected': str(flag)}) @wrap_check_policy

commit_message:
Add admin_metadata 'protected' for volume

Aim to enhance the protection for the volume to avoid deletion by mistake.
The volume can not be deleted until the 'protected' is setted to 'False'.

Change-Id: If7ed26d15f2c0eb289e3bf6a96e2ea685763e9e6
Implements: blueprint protected-volume
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder-specs refs/changes/21/97821/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== support protect property for volume ========================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/protected-volume Problem description =================== This blueprint is aim to add a "protect property" for cinder volume. If "protect property" is True, the volume can't be deleted. If "protect property" is False, the volume can be deleted. User can change the "protect property" for a volume. With this feature, we can have a better protect for the import volume. Proposed change =============== 'protected' property in cinder volume is implemented as an admin metadata. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- Available value for protected is "true" or "false". Add a new action for the extension "VolumeActions" For example:: POST /v1/{tenant_id}/volumes/{volume_id}/action { "os-update_protected_flag": {"protected": true} } Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: vitas.yuzhou Other contributors: boh.ricky Work Items ---------- 'protected' property in cinder volume is implemented as an admin metadata. * add api for set volume protected property * add implement in cinder volume api * add unit test Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= None Documentation Impact ==================== Need to add the info about the new API in the document. References ========== None

commit_message:
Make starting cinder services possible with "pudb", too.

"pudb" is a ncurses-based python debugger; running the cinder service
without this change results in a mis-detection of the service name,
so the process tries to provide "runpy" services, which won't work.

Change-Id: I3551d73579e21f6eacf7640e8257aae7d1bb782d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/69/98969/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if binary == 'runpy.py': # started via debugger binary = os.path.basename(inspect.stack()[1][1])

commit_message:
Add code for Huawei SDSHypervisor driver and connector

It uses socket and CLI to communicate with SDSHypervisor
to perform the following:
* Create/Delete Volume
* Extend Volume
* Create/Delete Snapshot
* Create Volume from Snapshot
* Delete Volume Snapshot
* Attach/Detach Volume
* Get Volume Stats
* Clone Volume

Certification test result for Huawei SDSHypervisor:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1368064

Change-Id: I97ebd55e57d53af9541bc5aca9790b9d484501b1
Implements: blueprint huawei-sdshypervisor-driver

commit_message:
Fix wrong arg number for _fix_id_migration issue

If the provider_location doesn't contain the name of the volume, TGT and
ISER will fail on doing a id migration, due to wrong number of
arguments.

Change-Id: I420ceaf14edfb6a0e3b8fd1f50070dc70b6f16bd
Closes-Bug: #1386902
(cherry picked from commit f61b3bd0beb52808383358de15df39dcaf2aa60c)

Implement restore operation

This adds new methods to manage snapshot restoration.

blueprint stack-snapshot
Co-Authored-By: ala.rezmerita@cloudwatt.com

Change-Id: I917c5d89f586110c0614e05e134bebde27d4db55
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-heatclient refs/changes/13/124413/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @utils.arg('snapshot', metavar='<SNAPSHOT>', help='The ID of the snapshot to restore.') def do_stack_restore(hc, args): '''Restore a snapshot of a stack.''' fields = {'stack_id': args.id, 'snapshot_id': args.snapshot} try: hc.stacks.restore(**fields) except exc.HTTPNotFound: raise exc.CommandError('Stack or snapshot not found') @utils.arg('id', metavar='<NAME or ID>', help='Name or ID of stack to query.')

commit_message:
Move common functions into functional test base-class

The list_resources and update_stack are generic and likely to be used
in multiple tests, so move them into the test base-class.

Change-Id: I20b5399212a3dde514e0785b1fc91be2c30cba04
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/07/136007/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def update_stack(self, stack_identifier, template, environment=None, files=None): env = environment or {} env_files = files or {} stack_name = stack_identifier.split('/')[0] self.client.stacks.update( stack_id=stack_identifier, stack_name=stack_name, template=template, files=env_files, disable_rollback=True, parameters={}, environment=env ) self._wait_for_stack_status(stack_identifier, 'UPDATE_COMPLETE') def list_resources(self, stack_identifier): resources = self.client.resources.list(stack_identifier) return dict((r.resource_name, r.resource_type) for r in resources)

commit_message:
SoftwareDeployments make servers property updateable

Allow the servers list to be updated, which will cause an update
of the resource group instead of replacing it.

This looks inconvenient to test in the unit tests due to needing
to create a coupled nested stack (which will further impede the
decouple-nested work), so I'll post a followup patch with a
functional test instead, if that's viewed as acceptable.

Change-Id: I1714d2cef2d0edbeb82c16e5a83acc458009bd47
Closes-Bug: #1389178
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/89/135689/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: update_allowed=True

added_lines: @utils.arg('id', metavar='<NAME or ID>', help='Name or ID of stack to query.') @utils.arg('-n', '--name', metavar='<SNAPSHOT>', help='If specified, the name given to the snapshot.') def do_stack_snapshot(hc, args): '''Make a snapshot of a stack.''' fields = {'stack_id': args.id} if args.name: fields['name'] = args.name try: snapshot = hc.stacks.snapshot(**fields) except exc.HTTPNotFound: raise exc.CommandError('Stack not found: %s' % args.id) else: print(jsonutils.dumps(snapshot, indent=2)) @utils.arg('id', metavar='<NAME or ID>', help='Name or ID of stack to query.') @utils.arg('snapshot', metavar='<SNAPSHOT>', help='The ID of the snapshot to show.') def do_snapshot_show(hc, args): '''Show a snapshot of a stack.''' fields = {'stack_id': args.id, 'snapshot_id': args.snapshot} try: snapshot = hc.stacks.snapshot_show(**fields) except exc.HTTPNotFound: raise exc.CommandError('Stack or snapshot not found') else: print(jsonutils.dumps(snapshot, indent=2)) @utils.arg('id', metavar='<NAME or ID>', help='Name or ID of stack to query.') @utils.arg('snapshot', metavar='<SNAPSHOT>', help='The ID of the snapshot to delete.') def do_snapshot_delete(hc, args): '''Delete a snapshot of a stack.''' fields = {'stack_id': args.id, 'snapshot_id': args.snapshot} try: hc.stacks.snapshot_delete(**fields) except exc.HTTPNotFound: raise exc.CommandError('Stack or snapshot not found') @utils.arg('id', metavar='<NAME or ID>', help='Name or ID of stack to query.') def do_snapshot_list(hc, args): '''List the snapshots of a stack.''' fields = {'stack_id': args.id} try: snapshots = hc.stacks.snapshot_list(**fields) except exc.HTTPNotFound: raise exc.CommandError('Stack not found: %s' % args.id) else: fields = ['id', 'status', 'status_reason', 'data'] formatters = { 'id': lambda x: x['id'], 'status': lambda x: x['status'], 'status_reason': lambda x: x['status_reason'], 'data': lambda x: jsonutils.dumps(x['data'], indent=2), } utils.print_list(snapshots["snapshots"], fields, formatters=formatters)

commit_message:
Cinder volume driver for Open vStorage Volume Router - specs

Change-Id: I3fae9ec89515b5fbcea3a54f2c7080c48b17a0dd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder-specs refs/changes/56/130756/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ==================================================== Cinder volume driver for Open vStorage Volume Router ==================================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/open-vstorage-volume-driver Open vStorage is an open-source VM storage router. Its a SDS layer in between Virtual machines and storage backends, it abstracts the backend from the VM and provides a single unified namespace across multiple hosts. These VM Storage Routers operate like a grid leveraging local flash memory or SSDs to provide a high performance and reliable storage system. Problem description =================== Today no solution exists to use OpenStack SWIFT as primary storage for virtual machines. Proposed change =============== The Open vStorage volume driver will bring you the capability for any S3 compatible Object Storage supporting the concept of namespaces(aka buckets) to be used as a persistent primary storage backend for Openstack virtual machines. It will be located under cinder/volume/drivers/openvstorage and be able to perform following actions: * Create/Delete Volume * Attach/Detach Volume * Create/Delete Snapshot * Create Volume from Snapshot * Get Volume Stats * Copy Image to Volume * Copy Volume to Image * Clone Volume * Extend Volume Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ For optimal performance the driver will ensure that the volumes are activated on the hypervisor node running the virtual machines. A storage backend can be partitioned into several vPools each identified by a different Cinder volume type. Other deployer impact --------------------- The main Cinder config file contains the name of the Open vStorage vPool and the Cinder volume configuration file will add the custom Open vStorage installation path to the PYTHONPATH. The nova configuration is configured with an instance_name template equal to the hostname of the virtual machine. Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: <eduard.matei@openvstorage.com> Work Items ---------- Capability to migrate volumes. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= A Cinder CI will be testing the hypervisor related features. Documentation Impact ==================== Using the Open vStorage volume driver will be documented. Cinder Support Matrix should get updated. References ========== http://www.openvstorage.com

commit_message:
Adding query filtering support to Sahara

In order to better handle potentially large result
sets, Sahara needs to support filtering via query
parameters.  This spec lays out the affected areas
(sahara service, python-saharaclient, horizon).
APIImpact

Change-Id: Id735e1ffd0f966f93c1f6a27fd1378d02385256c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara-specs refs/changes/19/134319/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== Spec - Add support for filtering results ========================================== Blueprints: Sahara service: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/sahara/+spec/enable-result-filtering Client library: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/python-saharaclient/+spec/enable-result-filtering Horizon UI: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/horizon/+spec/data-processing-table-filtering As result sets can be very large when dealing with nontrivial openstack environments, it is desirable to be able to filter those result sets by some set of field constraints. This spec lays out how Sahara should support such queries. Changes will be required in the API, client library, and in the Horizon UI. Problem description =================== The original use case for this change came up when we wanted to provide a way to filter some of the tables in the UI. In order to make that filtering possible, either the UI has to perform the filtering (inefficient since large result sets would still be returned by the api) or the api/client library need to provide support for such filtering. Upon review of other api/client libraries, it looks like most, if not all, provide filtering capabilities. Sahara should also make filtering possible. Proposed change =============== In order to make filtering possible, each of the "list()" methods in the client library should be extended to take an optional (default=None) parameter, "search_opts". "search_opts" should be a dict that will include one or more {field:query} entries. Pagination can also be handled through search_opts by allowing for the setting of page/page_size/max results. In addition, the REST api needs to be extended for the list() operations to support query syntax. This will require changes to how Sahara currently does its database queries to include query options. Currently, they are set to just return all entries for each call. Alternatives ------------ Filtering could be done entirely in the UI, but that is a wasteful way to do it since each library/api call will still return the full result set. Also, any users of the REST api or the client library would not benefit from this functionality. It would also be possible to just implement filtering at the client library level, but for the same reasons that doing it in the UI is undesirable, this approach is also suboptimal. Data model impact ----------------- No changes to the model itself should be required. Only changes to how we query the database are needed. REST API impact --------------- The following methods will need to be changed to support query-style parameters. The underlaying database access methods will need to be changed from the basic "get all" functionality to support a **kwargs parameter (this is already done in cluster_get_all(), but needs to be done for ther other methods). Other end user impact --------------------- Users of the REST API, client library and Horizon UI will be able to filter their result sets via simple queries. Deployer impact --------------- These changes should not affect deployment of the Sahara service. Developer impact ---------------- No developer impact. Sahara-image-elements impact ---------------------------- No sahara-image-elements imbact. Sahara-dashboard / Horizon impact --------------------------------- Once the REST API and client library changes are in place, the Horizon UI will be modified to allow for filtering on the following tables: Clusters, Cluster Templates, Node Group Templates, Job Executions, Jobs. It would also be possible to filter any of our tables in the future without any other API/client library changes. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: croberts (Horizon UI) Other contributors: <available> (REST API/sahara.db.api) <available> (Client Library) Work Items ---------- These may be able to be worked on in parallel, but they must be released in the order they are given below. 1. REST API implementation 2. Client library implementation 3. Horizon UI implementation Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= There should be tests added against the REST interface, client library and Horizon UI to test the filtering capabilities being added. Documentation Impact ==================== Docs for the REST API will need to be updated to reflect the querying functionality. Docs for the client library will need to be updated to reflect the querying functionality. The dashboard user guide should be updated to note the table filtering functionality that will be added. References ========== Sahara service: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/sahara/+spec/enable-result-filtering Client library: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/python-saharaclient/+spec/enable-result-filtering Horizon UI: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/horizon/+spec/data-processing-table-filtering

commit_message:
Implement migration of legacy routers to distributed

This patch addresses the necessary changes required
for the router migration or conversion from legacy
to distributed.

The _update_router_db() method was modified to add
logic to support the SNAT functionality of DVR by
calling create_snat_intf_ports_if_not_exists().  A
call to _unbind_router() was also called to force
the scheduling of the router with 'distributed'
enabled.

Right now we will be supporting migration from legacy
to distributed only.

Closes-bug: #1348309
Partially-implements: blueprint neutron-ovs-dvr
Co-Authored-By: Michael Smith <michael.smith6@hp.com>
Change-Id: I6f252271bb5b52ce57184ad7b0bf1ce280b965fb

commit_message:
Validate loadbalancing method when updating a pool

Validate the input for the lb_method and avoid DBIntegrityError.

Change-Id: Iea3d464abdeb1ed377db2453581124742f9fb0ac
Closes-Bug: #1390078
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/28/135628/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_update_pool_invalid_lb_method(self): with self.pool() as pool: update_data = {'pool': {'lb_method': 'dummy'}} req = self.new_update_request('pools', update_data, pool['pool']['id'], fmt=self.fmt) res = req.get_response(self.ext_api) self.assertEqual(webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest.code, res.status_int)

commit_message:

added the four major release stages

commit_message:
make devstack docs job only run on master

Devstack webpage should only be updated on master changes,
on stable this doesn't even run correctly at this point.

Change-Id: I25c476042d52152454d0d9300042fdb120951401

commit_message:
Enforce log hints in neutron.services

This change enforces log hints use and removes debug level log
translation, modifications are validated through a hacking rule.

Validate that hacking rules apply to directories:
    - neutron/services

Change-Id: Ib744b7a94705afbefeb50b5dce933d226831f580
Partial-bug: #1320867

commit_message:
Enforce log hints in neutron.services.metering

This change enforces log hints use and removes debug level log
translation, modifications are validated through a hacking rule.

Validate that hacking rules apply to directories:
    - neutron/services/metering

Change-Id: Ic763e81e8b06973013115af45c7c09a3e69c673b
Partial-bug: #1320867
